reviewDescription: It works, it blows hot air. It doesn't blow super strong but it blows good enough. However, the concentrator attachment does not fit very strongly, so as you dry your hair it twists around and pops off.
Not enough power/air flow on its highest setting. If you want one with maximum air volume, you can do better. I went to a thrift store after buying this and bought one with twice the air flow...

My wife bought it in March 2024 and at the end of May the high mode started to make a sound like it was about to blow. It doesn’t matter the temperature but not she can only dry on low, which takes her forever with thick hair. Wish it would have last longer. Still works fine but a bummer it only last 2 months before something went wrong.
It doesn’t produce high temperature air

reviewTitle: Cool is warm, warm is hot, and hot is very hot
reviewDescription: This dryer works fine, but there is no true cool temperature because the cool setting is actually warm. I can't even imagine someone trying to dry their hair on the hot setting.Other than that, like I said, it works fine, comparable to almost any other dryer on the market.
It does the job for the price. Would like it to have a more power but you get what you pay for.
Not the best but does the job

I really like the Dryer. It's on the quieter side for sure but unfortunately it takes a while to heat up and dry my hair.I love the sleek look too it, I just wish it heated up quick and dried my hair quicker.The other thing I noticed is the outside coat is easily scratch able so I'm careful when I put it back because I don't want it to look too damaged

This dryer is not nearly as effective (takes longer to style hair) as the prior Conair with retractable cord we previously used. However, the rocker switches are easier to use than the slides in the old dryer.  Really wish we still had the old dryer.

reviewTitle: White finish on hair dryer handle disintegrated
reviewDescription: I liked this hair dryer a lot.  However, over a period of time (5+ months), the white finish on the handle began to disintegrate.  Little white flecks ended up in my hair and on my hands.  They were surprisingly hard to remove.

reviewTitle: Good hairdryer for the price, but the power could definitely be stronger
reviewDescription: I had owned a Revlon brand for more than 13 years. It was no longer blowing hot air to blow dry my hair so after 13 years, I had to part with it. I saw this one for about the same price that I had bought the revlon one so I decided to give it try. It is lightweight, it is sturdy and I love the chic color, but unfortunately it does not compare to the power of my old 13 year old blow dryer. That is the main reason I am giving it four stars. I also give it three stars for "traveling" as it is pretty big and it does not come with a traveling bag. Other than that, I guess it does the job and it does blow dry my hair which is the purpose, but I wish it had more power so my hair could be dried faster.

reviewTitle: Had to replace my old hair dryer
reviewDescription: I have always used Conair hair dryers. I was looking for the one that recoils the cord but it had been out of stock so I got this one and it is not quite as powerful. I do miss the cord recoiling other than that this does the job for a great price.

reviewTitle: Quiet but not as powerful as I'd like
reviewDescription: Lightweight and pretty quiet compared to my last hairdryer. But I have pretty long hair and this isn't as powerful as I'd like, so it takes a little longer to blowout my hair with it. You can change it from low to high and hot to cool and that's great. It's good for the price, I just need a stronger one, but I still use it often.
Blow dryer worked for about 5 months then the heating element went out

reviewTitle: Doesn't seem to get hot enough
reviewDescription: Overall, this is a great dryer. It's lightweight and sleek looking and has lots of settings and a concentrator included. It leaves my fine hair with fewer flyaways than other dryers. My only gripe is it doesn't get hot enough even on the hottest setting to really do a thorough enough job to get my hair completely dry without spending a lot more time drying.
It lacks some power but does the job. I bought it for a rental place, so value was important, and this hairdryer delivers that. The white looks very nice too.

I should have taken note of the wattage because it's not as powerful as the last blow dryer I had. But it's OK. I have short hair that dries quickly. If you have long or thick hair, you might need more power.
It does what it is supposed to do

reviewTitle: Great price for quality blow dryer!!
reviewDescription: Such a great price on a really quality blow dryer!! The only thing I would change would be the cord length is a bit short for my liking…..otherwise dries my long but fine hair very quickly! Definitely worth the price point!

I probably should have ordered a 2000 + watt tourmaline dryer. It makes my hair a little frizzy and doesn’t blow that hard, but it seems to dry the hair fast enough. It’s okay, it’s a blow dryer I suppose.  I would give it 3.5 stars. It’s not overly loud, if you’re looking for a quieter dryer, and it’s very light weight, perhaps the lightest dryer I have ever held, which is great for someone with a shoulder injury. It’s lighter than my travel dryer which is smaller, but unfortunately it’s as under powered as the travel dryer. If you don’t spend extra time, it will probably give you a bad hair day just like the travel dryer.

Very Nice Hair Dryer!  I bought this for my daughter for a Christmas present.  She has been using it on her knee length hair for about 6 weeks.  She really likes it.This Conair dryer is nice looking and easy to hold.  The handle is comfortable, and it is light enough to not make her arm ache from holding it up.  There are different settings for how hot or hard you want it to blow.  The air is diffused in a way that helps protect your hair from damage.  My daughter can tell the difference in her hair from the old dinosaur dryer she had been using.  She also feels that even though it is gentle, it has been drying her hair much faster than her old one was.The price was reasonable for a nice quality dryer.  If you need one, I recommend you try the Conair Double Ceramic Dryer for yourself.  Thanks for reading. Have a blessed day!
Purchased to put in our guest bathroom. Works well and the temperature controls are on point. Power of the hair dryer is wonderful. Lots of settings to choose from. Great value for the money.
I like this hairdryer because it’s lightweight and easy to use. Has several settings and does a good job.

Trying to decide between these new fancy dryers that cost $70 and way higher and what I know to be an old fashioned reliable ConAir or Revlon drove me crazy. But guess what, all those features in the more expensive ones can be found in the less expensive ones.  The ceramic I chose over the babybliss titanium because it’s gentler on the hair, less damage.Negative ions, who knew this BS works.Quieter than my old revlon. but hey still a hairdryer, makes noise. Weight comparative to the old style but unless this is your profession or you have a personal issue, it’s really not heavy.Flyaway hair minimal, better shine, better styling and great cool shot.Saw this on Todays deals for $15.  So what do you really have yo loose?Highly recommended!Double ceramic technology in this hair dryer provides infrared and uniform heat for fast drying and less damage. TRUE, who knewConditioning ions in this blow dryer help to fight frizz and bring out your hair’s natural shine. TRUEThis dryer for hair dries your hair fast with 1875 watts of power. TRUEI have somewhat thick hair below shoulder and this dries in less than ten minutes with styling.A cool shot button locks hair styles in place TRUENo pieces are chipping off as others have stated.  But honestly if they did I wouldn’t care.  My hair looks great and healthier.

The Conair Double Ceramic Hair Dryer has revolutionized my at-home styling routine. With 1875W of power and built-in ionic conditioning, this hair dryer delivers professional results without the salon price tag.Powerful and Efficient: 💨The 1875W motor ensures a powerful airflow that dries my hair quickly and efficiently. Say goodbye to long drying times – this hair dryer gets the job done in no time, saving me precious minutes during my morning routine.Frizz-Free Shine with Ionic Conditioning: ✨The built-in ionic conditioning is a game-changer for combating frizz and enhancing shine. My hair feels noticeably smoother and looks healthier after each use. It's like having a salon blowout in the comfort of my own home.Double Ceramic Technology: 🌪️The double ceramic technology is a standout feature. Not only does it contribute to even heat distribution, preventing hot spots, but it also helps protect hair from damage. I appreciate the peace of mind knowing that my hair is being cared for while I style.Lightweight and Maneuverable: 🎈This hair dryer is incredibly lightweight, making it easy to handle and maneuver. Whether I'm styling with a round brush or simply giving my hair a quick blast of air, the ergonomic design ensures comfort during extended use.Multiple Heat and Speed Settings: 🔥⚡The customizable heat and speed settings cater to my specific styling needs. Whether I want a gentle cool setting for a final set or high heat for quick drying, this hair dryer adapts to my preferences effortlessly.Conclusion: 🌬️In conclusion, the Conair Double Ceramic Hair Dryer is a must-have for anyone seeking salon-worthy results at home. Its powerful performance, ionic conditioning, and double ceramic technology make it a standout in the world of hair dryers. Say hello to a faster, frizz-free drying experience that leaves your hair looking and feeling fabulous. I highly recommend this hair dryer to anyone in search of a reliable and effective styling tool!
Good value & works very well
I replaced my old Conair with this one and I love it. I never had any problems with Conair
the heat setting is variable which is gret
This works well and looks good too.
This is a great hair dryer. I've had no issues and it has been a great option, especially for the price.

I do not recommend this hair dryer. Although it is 1875 watts it does not blow very strong nor it it very hot. I have long curly hair and it takes forever to dry with this dryer. I bought this becuase of the price and it has a diffuser. It also said less frizz etc so It had me sold.  Not true. Buy a different brand if you are in a hurry to dry your hair. You get what you pay for.

reviewTitle: Cheap but will do the job for now I guess
reviewDescription: Flimsy and cheap. Air blow is not strong. But what can you expect for $20. I will use it for now and next time invest at least $80 or some to a quality product

The power button and heat control button are on the handle.  When I grip the handle more often than not I end up changing a setting; either the low/medium/high fan speed, or the cool/medium/high heat setting.  Also, the cool setting is warm air and not just air flowing through the device.

reviewTitle: Does not get hot and buttons suck...
reviewDescription: Received right away and tossed the box because a blow dryer is a blow dryer right? Wrong! I have a lot of long hair and usually use "high and hot" the high option worked but hot was luke warm. The buttons are in an awkward spot on the handle and about 2 days in I accidentally hit the switch from "hot" to "warm" and miraculously the temperature changed from luke warm to HOT! So apparently the switch is wired incorrectly. Well thankfully those buttons are in a weird spot otherwise I would have never moved them. Occasionally, I hit them and it goes back to luke warm and I have to adjust it again. No box so no return. I'll just wait for it to die before I replace. The only good thing is that it's white and pretty.

reviewTitle: First very loud noise. Then a glow
reviewDescription: Having used this product for two week vacations and 2 a week at home this hair dryer was used less than any other  hair dryer we have owned. It made a very loud noise, had a glow and the abruptly stopped working. It has treated properly and the cord never abused. I don't think it was worth the money. In fact it left us all with frizz that we never had, and damaged our hair.
Idk but I think they painted the blow dryer white because it peels off it be all over your hand

I have used a Moroccan oil brush for years and straightened my hair with the hair dryer and the brush. My old dryer died and so I ordered this one. My hair winds up all wavy no matter how long I hold the dryer on the brush while twirling it.
The cord is too short making me stay in one position.

The plug on the Conair dryer needs a special GFCI outlet and you need to test and reset it every time you use it. Also it came missing a part, the concentrator, which is more than helpful if you have long hair. Unfortunately I opened the package after the return date, but seeing as i don't have a GFCI outlet it is pretty useless to me.
The blow dryer itself is fine, but all the paint on it started chipping off soon after I started using it. Then I end up with white paint flakes all over my hair. Would not purchase again.

Haven't used it yet but right out of the box, I don't like the fan shape of the nozzle, which I noticed in the pictures but was hoping it would be better in-person, and the cord is less than 5 feet long. For reference, my professional round brush dryer cord is 9 feet long.

Took weeks longer to get product.  Ordered another one and this one came one day before the other one I ordered two weeks later.  Tried both hair dryers and they both worked the same, so I kept this one and returned the other one.  Now I wish I would have kept the other one.  Two months in and i kept seeing white paint on my hands, in my hair and on my hairbrush.  Couldn't figure out at first, then I noticed peeling paint on my hairdryer.  Added duct tape to the handle so it wouldn't get over everything.  Highly disappointed.  Would not recommend product.

reviewTitle: Beautiful but doesn't have convenient cool air option
reviewDescription: Cord is long enough for me, beautiful product. However the "cool" option isn't actually cool air, and would only have cold air blowing if you press the cold blast button. The button needs to be held down completely if you want to have cool air, henve very inconvenient. The drying power of the product is also not very strong.
Is a good size and functional enough. But even on high it does not have a great Air Force. If you have thick hair this would take you forever to dry it!

The hairdryer works great. However, cord it so is very short.  It’s also fairly quiet. I have very thin hair so it’s great but for someone with a lot of hair, I’m not sure how quickly it will dry the hair

This is a great dryer and I would definitely give it more stars if didn't have to pick at all the peeling paint from my clothes and skin. For some reason the paint that coats the dryer just started peeling and it leaves a mess every time.

reviewTitle: Got most of what I paid for
reviewDescription: You get the product you pay for in terms of strength. be advised it does not include the nozzle as is blatantly shown on the box and other images
Compared to my previous experience, the air flow is inadequate and the cord is too short.Sending mine back.
Work,s good. For the money I would look around a bit, but I'm not under selling it.
The cool setting and the warm are exactly the same temperature. Replaced my old one, similar model but doesn't work as well at all. Sad the cool setting doesn't work.
I like the hair dryer overall but the cord is so short!
The cord is just way too short.  I wish they listed the length in the description.
Good for home use.
I have no problems with this hair dryer, good price and dries my hair

reviewTitle: My Daughter Liked It Very Much
reviewDescription: This was a Christmas gift to my daughter. She took it out of the box and looked it over. She thought it was really nice and looked expensive. She was excited to use it.
I like the fact that this is a strong blow dryer but I wish it was smaller.
It’s heavy!
For me its great. I just need to get my hair dry and go about my day.  There are enough options for settings aka cool, warm, high, low, etc.  The cord isn't super long, but honestly not a big deal.
This dryer is very light. It blows hard, but does not get as hot as my previous Conair dyer. It will work for what I need though.

reviewTitle: So far it’s a great hairdryer
reviewDescription: Could be a little smaller to fit in drawer!

This hair dryer is fine. It’s good because it’s quiet and light weight. Things I don’t like are that the cord is VERY short making it difficult to switch arms and sides of my head without moving where I’m standing, so kind of annoying. Also the buttons are very sensitive. If I accidentally lightly touch the air flow button it changes super easily from high to low, so also an annoyance. It was pretty inexpensive though, so I guess these are minor irritations for what I paid for it.
I was surprised at the lack of power this has. I had it on high and it took quite a long time to dry my hair. I would not recommend this product.
I wish the blowing power was a little more.

reviewTitle: Big problem with this hairdryer,  electrical cord is way too short!
reviewDescription: Dryer works ok,  but cord is way too short!

reviewTitle: Dries hair quickly but not sure if it is truly “ionic” dryer.
reviewDescription: Pros: strong air with three levels of heat. I typically use medium heat with strongest air.Cons: I used to own similar “ionic” dryer and really liked how it dried my hair. It maintained the right amount of moisture. However this one does not provide same effect.  I doubt that this is truly a ionic hair dryer.
The hairdryer works fine but the coating on it comes off and I now have small pieces of white paint everywhere. Next time I’ll stick with a black model.

reviewTitle: Dryer works great but finish is wearing off
reviewDescription: Works great but now it gets white particles all over my hands after 3 months. I guess I got a defective finish on mine. Wish I could return.

reviewTitle: Works well but not made well
reviewDescription: I do love the dryer, dries fast and does a good job…but the quality of the dryer is not good. It’s while and apparently also painted white. Chips of paint are in my hands every time after I blow dry my hair :(
This blowdryer works well, and is lightweight.  But, I am getting white flakes off the plastic handle that stick to everything.
Average for use . Nothing special . Good for the money

This is an okay dryer. It does the trick if you have enough time. I find it not powerful enough for me andI have chin length hair. Can't imagine using it on really long thick hair. The buttons are inconveniently placed and can be switched to a different setting or off entirely when holding the handle. It's light enough to handle, not heavy. I bought a smaller 1800+ dryer that is twice as powerful. I will keep this one as a spare. It may be okay for some people who maybe have short hair and don't need extra power/heat.
Blow dryer is fine but the cord is so short (at least 5 inches shorter than my other hot tools) that it’s actually problematic.
The blow dryer works great if you don’t mind the paint chips getting stuck to your hands and face while you use it.

I've never really disliked a hairdryer before, but this one fails on two points. First, the ergonomics seem off--it is not especially comfortable to hold, especially if you've got arthritic hands. The control buttons are awkwardly placed, so there are a lot of unintentional power changes because it's easy to tap the wrong button while gripping the handle. Second, the cord is very short--if your outlet is not very close to the mirror you're using, the cord length is going to be a problem. This has been one of my go-to hairdryer brands for many years, so I'm disappointed that this model is sort of a diva to work with. The airflow and temperature levels are normal, but the devil is in the details on this one.

It’s a good hair dryer for the price. My hair feels soft after I dry it. There’s enough power to dry my long hair quickly but not cook the shine out of it. So perhaps the ceramic does make a difference? It’s lightweight & easy to store. Now my negatives are-  the controls are right where I naturally hold the dryer so I’ve accidentally turned it off or down mid-dry. But I’ll train myself to grasp under the nozzle the way many stylists do. The biggest issue (that I pbly should’ve returned it for) was that cord is ridiculously short! Fire the person who thought a stubby cord was a good idea! Luckily I have a small bathroom with the plug next to the mirror so if I don’t take any steps, I’m ok, but when I bend over to dry the roots & under layer of hair, I have to be very careful or the cord yanks the plug. If you like/need to move around while you dry your hair, this is not the one for you.
It is not as powerful as I would like it to be

reviewTitle: Don't buy unless your hair is fine annd thin.
reviewDescription: My hair is on the thicker side and I could not get it dry in the time I had. I don't have 45 min to blow dry my hair.  Will have to get another one that is more powerful. I can't even return it because none of the return reasons are true. It does work, it just doesn't work well enough to get the job done in a reasonable length of time.

this is the cheapest one i would buy and it's ok but you'll need a few minutes because the high temp and  the high speed together isn't super hot id say it's just barely acceptable but it won't dry out/damage your hair right away if you hold it a moment so that's good. like i said, barely acceptable, it was cheap though so no complaints

So this is an inexpensive dryer. What are you giving up versus a more expensive model? Two mainly:1. There is no foam mesh dust filter. This allows dust to build up on the inner wire mesh (the one you can’t twist off and clean). eventually enough dust will build up to burn out the dryer. You can try using a q-tip to painstakingly clean the inner wire mesh, or add the missing washable foam filter (if you have one laying around. See photo.2. See that nice matte white finish? Con air cheaped out and used paint that’s not heat resistant. The finish will start cracking and flaking off, starting from the hot air end. In addition to looking beatup, this hair dryer will leave lots of little white flakes in your home/hair as it looses its paint. See the other photo.This hairdryer is still usable, but be aware of the compromises Conair made.

I love the dryer itself. It’s relatively quiet, dries my hair quickly, and works great. That being said…the concentrator is awful!  It pops off every few minutes.  It’s so frustrating and very disappointing from a company like Conair!
The power of this dryer is great. However, on the highest setting it warm at best. It’s a good thing I have fine hair.  If you have thick hair., plan on taking a while.
Very awkward to handle. Light weight yet very hard to keep a good grip on. Control buttons on handle get in the way and changes the setting while dry my hair.

reviewTitle: Good bang for the buck, but not very high power
reviewDescription: This is a great hair dryer for the $ but isn't very strong in terms of drying power.  It works well for what it is.
It is not powerful and best for short hair and maybe a travel hair dryer. Reminded me of what you would find in a hotel bathroom.
I bought it last year in march and it’s been peeling, this isn’t recent, and I don’t even use it often. But it’s Ight
Performs fine but the cord is short. Should be a foot or more longer.

My hair dryer of 18 years finally needed to be replaced. I bought this one in hopes of a good replacement. Sadly, I'm not very happy with it. The only things that I feel it has going for it was it is nice looking and light weight. The issues I have is the cord isn't very long. Can't move around very much while using. Another issue is it doesn't get very hot. Warm temp is much the same as hot. This causes it to take forever to dry my hair and hard to style it. The other issue is the large buttons. They take up most of the handle so you can't really grab it or you are constantly pushing buttons. I ended up buying a different one. Since I threw the box away for this one, I am stuck with it. Will have it as a back up if needed.
Not the best,, but works for me

I’ve had this hairdryer for about 4 months. Initially, I was very pleased with it except for the fact that it had a strong smell. It was kind of like a new transistor radio or new electronic smell, but it was much stronger than I’ve ever experienced with a new product before. As I anticipated, the smell has diminished over time but is still noticeable. The other problem is that the paint finish on the handle is peeling off and leaves little white flakes on my hands and sometimes face and hair. I’ve decided to try and scrape it all off and put an end to it, but buyer be warned! See photos.

reviewTitle: No cumple con la 3 funciones de calor.
reviewDescription: El producto es aceptable en cuanto a precio pero no cumple con la función de las 3 temperaturas o calor. El frío funciona solamente si presionas el botón azul. Por lo demás aún no he tenido problema.
Good dryer. Easy on hair. Wish it got a little hotter. A little too big to travel with.

reviewTitle: Conair Double Ceramic White Hair Dryer
reviewDescription: This Conair Hair Dryer is well made and powerful. It is heavier than my last dryer. I have not had any paint issues so far (one month). My only issue is the diffuser does not have a good attachment system and keeps falling off.
It just works!  Only negative is it's a bit heavy and bulky.

I bought this dryer because it was cost effective, but I wish I had paid more for a professional quality dryer. It does an adequate job, but I wish it was more powerful. I will probably replace it with a more powerful professional style dryer like the Chi and pass it on to my daughter.
Does a fine job but it is heavy
I like the look of these blow dryer but it doesn't get hot enough like I would like it too. But I will keep it and continue to use it.
Dryer is fine - settings are good.  The high setting isn't over powerful but dries well.  The only negative is the short cord.

I’d probably give this dryer more of a 3.5 than a 4 rating.  It has plenty of pros and cons.  Overall it’s good for the pricePros:-reasonable price-very light weight-gets hair dry in a decent amount of time-doesn’t leave hair frizzy-I personally like the short cordCons:-the plug keeps moving in the power socket, seems loose-not very hot, infact will probably never even turn down the temp to warm or cool as hot isn’t hot-no removable vent area to keep clean
Good quality for price.  Cord a bit short but that is perhaps better than way too long. Power not as strong as more expensive models, but gentler on fine hair.

reviewTitle: Not as Strong Airflow as My Old One
reviewDescription: The airflow isn't as strong as my older dryer. The diffuser on front doesn't lock in position. it twists around by itself and constantly needs to be re-aimed. The cord is too short. It feels like it's durable and well built. All in all it does the job.

The temperature does not get as hot as other hairdryers I have owned. The intensity of the airflow is also a little lackluster. I need extra heat for my coarse and long hair.  But for the price I should have known.  I will probably buy a better hairdryer and keep this as backup.

I love the heat and cool buttons but because of where the buttons are it makes it hard to hold without hitting the buttonsI end up turning the air down, or speed because there is really no where to put your fingers without hitting the buttons

This is a basic hairdryer, nothing fancy. It doesn't seem to have much power. It's pretty though, the white body and rose gold detailing. If that's what was the main thing I was looking for in a hairdryer I'd give this 5 stars.
It looks nice, it's light, it's hot enough and cool enough.  Trouble is, it's got a very weak stream of air.  I did keep it, my hair is thin, so it's not that big a deal, but wouldn't recommend it.

reviewTitle: Dryer is decent. Packaging was shoddy.
reviewDescription: This is how my hair dryer arrived in the Amazon box. The Cool setting is more “lowest heat” than actually cool compared to my last Conair dryer. I’m not sure if that’s specific to this model or just my product. Other than that, I’m content with it.

I like this dryer - it’s quiet, lightweight and dries hair smoothly - but you better have an outlet above your sink, and don’t expect to turn around or move very far. This cord is barely 3’ long - SUPER ANNOYING

Pros: I love the color. The heating power is good.Cons:  I dont like that while I am drying my hair and I am holding it, accidentally I push the buttomswith my hand  because the buttons are not flushed to the rest of the surface of the hair dryer. So while holding it, I have to be very aware that my hands dont touch the buttons.  It becomes annoying.  I have another Conair with flushed buttons which does not have this problem.
I am not totally satisfied with this product, but I continue to use it anyway. It has "curb appeal" with the white and rose gold accent. The cord is shorter, so it's not for salon use.
This is a ok product but not the best. I think the $10 one I got a Walmart is better but it does work ok and is lightweight for a bigger dryer

reviewTitle: Good, but dose not have strong enough fan speed
reviewDescription: This is a basic hair dryer and nothing elsePros:SleekLight weightCheepCons:Short cordDoes not have strong fan speed

I have fine, thin straight hair and normally I love Conair products and was excited to see how cheap it was. It takes forever to dry my hair, leaves it frizzy and flat despite me not changing anything else about my styling routine. It's not bad for the price but not what I need

The blow dryer itself is great. A few months into using it, I noticed white flakes all over and could not figure out from where.I finally realized it was from the blow dryer paint- it get stuck in hair, face, hands - what a. Mess - disappointing because it’s a good dryer
Replaced an old Conair hairdryer. This one is not nearly as powerful as my last one. It takes forever to dry my hair. I will be looking for something better.

I was very disappointed in this specific hair dryer. It had the features I was looking for which included multiple heat speed and heat levels. The drying power however was very sad. There seemed to be enough force of air coming out but after 20 minutes my hair (thin, not thick) hair was still wet. I tried using the air director attachment but that did not help in the least. I recommend looking at other products and not purchasing this unless you have all the time in the world to dry your hair.

reviewTitle: Works great but quality doesn’t last very long
reviewDescription: The power of the hairdryer is great I have been using it for about 9 months but about a month ago the paint started chipping and I can’t use it anymore because if you touch it the paint sticks to you and is a pain to get off.
The cord is way too short! I wouldn’t buy again
hopefully the smell goes away, but it almost smells like chemicals the first few times i used this i had to air out my apartment.

reviewTitle: Dries Hair But Paint is Peeling
reviewDescription: I ordered this dryer less than a month ago. It works fine, but a few days ago I noticed these little white flakes on my hand after I blow dried my hair. I didn’t think anything of it till today when I had a ton of white flakes on my hand after. I realized the matte white coating on the dryer was peeling. I’ve only used this dryer maybe 5 times at most in the last month. There is no reason the paint or top coating is peeling.

reviewTitle: Paint started flaking off during the first use and the dryer stopped working 10 months in.
reviewDescription: The drying mechanism itself I love.  However, within a few uses the white paint began flaking off and covering my hands and everything else I touch.  I had to cover the handle with tape but now the paint is flaking off the rest of the dryer.  I should have returned it but it actually took awhile to figure out where the flakes were coming from.UPDATE:  dryer died 10 months in of 4x week use.

I bought this blowdryer because it was cute, with the frosted white and rose gold colors, but what is not cute is taking out pieces of the frosted white from your hair, when you are in a hurry. The machine blow dries hair quickly, but by the time I'm done picking out the white chips from my hair and hands, it's taken as much time as my old blow drier, which I bought 20 years ago.
I replaced an older hair dryer with this and was disappointed. It's doesn't blow as hard as my old one. I'd look for a better alternative.

reviewTitle: Product did not last beyond 6 months.
reviewDescription: Dryer was noisy, diffuser would not stay in place, and exactly six months after purchase the motor died. Product was not misused or overused (used once a day). I have used Conair blowers for forty years and never had one fail in six months, they typically lasted many years.  I’m very disappointed in Amazon’s return policy on this item and discourage anyone from purchasing it. It is a low-quality, sub standard product that should be removed from your store.
After a year of working fine. Suddenly no heat. There was never much difference between warm and hot. Now all temps are cold. Very disappointed.

reviewTitle: Why toggle switches, why why why?
reviewDescription: for some reason every time I use this dryer I end up switching it to the low setting inadvertently because my finger hit the toggle switch unintentionally.  I did see a number of other dryers that have toggle switches too but really not a fan.
Nice for drying children’s hair or for someone who has little hair; but for thick and longer hair, this will not do the job!
Gets hot on the exterior of dryer during use, I don’t know if it’s because it’s ceramic but can’t use it continually until hair is dry.

This is the first and only hair dryer I’ve ever used that made my hair frizzy. I dried my hair the way I normally do. I tried it both with and without the attachment. My hair came out terrible and frizzy every time. Also, the high heat setting isn’t as warm as other hair dryers, so it takes quite a bit longer to dry my hair, too. Very disappointed and a little puzzled at the advertising that this hair dryer is designed to minimize frizz.
I paid for a brand new hairdryer, and what I received was a beat up box with a used hairdryer.

reviewTitle: It's Not the Worst Hair Dryer I've Owned But...
reviewDescription: its not the best, or even near to it either.  It doesn't put out a lot of blowing-power but I guess since I have fine hair, that is okay.  The thing that I really downgraded it for was the fact that the power cord is really short.  You better have a wall outlet high up or you have to stoop down to use it.  It also falls out of the wall plug really easily.  I would blame the wall plug except that this is the only thing that falls out of it.  Other plug in devices stay put.I wouldn't buy it again, and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone.

The hair dryer worked just fine, BUT the paint on it started chipping and flaking off. I’ve never experienced this with a hair dryer before. Really disappointed with the quality and ended up throwing it out.

reviewTitle: Seem it really protects my hair
reviewDescription: Seem it really protects my hair, the temperature is not too high to damage my hair.

reviewTitle: Perfect settings and easy to hold lightweight and attractive
reviewDescription: I love this hairdryer and multiple settings for blow volume and heat  settings. I recommend this dryer for thise of us that fund heavy dryers hard to Goldstein the drying styling process leaves my hair smooth and frizz free.
This is easy to use, serves its purpose wonderfully, and looks super cute. It has great power and I like the size.

The power cord is 52" long between strain relievers.  This shorter-than-usual cord is just right for me, as there's less "cord dangle" to snag and get hung up on bathroom cabinetry handles -- an everyday annoyance with my old blow dryer's  6-foot cord. The plug-in end of the Conair cord has a petite ground fault interrupt protector with a polarized plug. There's also a this-has-got-to-go warning label glued to the cord with caution statements about "do not use this appliance near the bathtub," and "do not remove this tag."The rocker switches that control the blower motor and air temperature seem easier to use than slide switches. They're smooth operating, and provide a definitive feel when switching between settings. The dryer is relatively quiet at low-volume air flow. It's louder but not completely obnoxious on the high setting. The temperature control (cool, warm, hot) provides a nice, useful temperature range. Even the cool setting has a little warmth to it, but there's also a blue snowflake button that, when pressed and held, disables the heating coils. Style a curl or wave with a brush or comb, and use this blue button for a few seconds to set the style into your hair.My previous hair dryer (a Sassoon 1875 watt) failed after 20+ years of almost daily use. Although it pained me to give up that old dryer, considering the lifespan of an appliance like this, the cost of ownership is a mere fraction of a cent per day. I think this Conair 1875 will probably last longer than my disappearing hair.
It not really for traveling because size.But for home is good for it’s price.

This is a very stylish hair dryer. But most importantly it is one of the best hair dryers that I've had. I have very thick hair and it takes a while for it to dry. But not with this one it doesn't take that long at all. Love the design the performance. And how easy it is to hold

reviewTitle: Fairly quiet, light weight weight, good controls
reviewDescription: I was surprised at how relatively quiet it was for the price.  Light in hand, won't blow your head off but plenty powerful for me, have no hair so I use for various warming and drying chores. I'm 83 and keep my mobile home at 62 over Vermont's 8 heating months so I value a warm dry after getting my hands wet in cold tap water (rinsing toothpaste remnants, coffee mugs and so on).Over 20-30 years have had a number of similar driers, this one is by far he best out of the box  Longevity is to be determined, the others lasted around 5 years of light multiple daily uses. with longer uses of 10 to 15 minutes to warm BR during showers and for "sitting" bathroom use during furnace breakdowns.
I bought this blow-dryer and I have been very pleased with this blow-dryer.

I like to leave things out and my husband likes things to be put away. I don't dry my hair often and upon looking for my hair dryer on the towel rack where I had last hung it (it was gone). Ask my husband where it was and he doesn't remember where he put it. We both looked for a little while around the bathroom and in the basement where I find most of my treasures hidden and we still couldn't find my old one. I was very pleased to find one that was easy to use and similar to my 25 year old one and affordable too. Perfect for me. Thank you. *****

A light weight hair dryer that does the job! I'm able to use all dryer settings daily, and my hair has benefited as a result. Haven't had an issue, and looks like this dryer will last me for a long time.

reviewTitle: White Paint flaking off on hands & hair
reviewDescription: This is a great little blow dryer but in less than a year the white paint started flaking off and ends up on my hands and hair. The white paint is all over my brown hair and hard to get out. It’s gross.
The voltage on the blow dryer is not high enough you have to use it on high to get any result

Loved the price and now I know why.Dryer seems like it's on low power in all settings. Package was delivered not factory packed. Seems like I bought a defective and returned dryer unbeknownst to me. Seller should have disclosed this.

I bought this as a replacement to my old one that just stopped working. Its the same brand and watt, conair 1875 but it is way less powerful. It has all the same buttons and settings but Compared to my old one this blower is much weaker. Much quiter too but not as strong. I guess for $16 dollars this is what you get.

I guess you get what you pay for with this one. I've used the same blow dryer for several years (and when I say "use", I mean I literally use it every. single. day) and absolutely loved it. My son knocked it into a toilet and I was pretty sure it was going to stop working, so I ordered this one out of desperation to get a replacement quickly. I made sure the stats matched my current hair dryer (1875W Ionic), but was very disappointed by the results. This blow dryer is nice enough but will take me twice as long to dry my hair than my old dryer. Luckily my old one is actually still working. Hoping to keep limping that one along until I can get a replacement, because this one is not a good fit for me.

reviewTitle: Cute hair dryer, but not the best or strongest
reviewDescription: I paid about $20 for this hair dryer. This is a cute hair dryer, but it was not the strongest - it took a long time to dry my hair with this. It claims that it helps fight frizz to bring out your hair's natural shine to make it smooth and sleek, but I felt like my hair was more frizzy after drying.

reviewTitle: It's plug scratches the bejesus out of the finish....
reviewDescription: I couldn't figure out where all the scratches on my brand new blow dryer were coming from. It was completely covered in them after a week. I thought it was something in the drawer, or my nails, but it wasn't. Finally figured out that it's own plug is what was doing it! If the plug even barely touches the dryer it makes a silver scratch in the white finish. Who makes a product like that?? Super disappointed because the blow dryer itself is fantastic- I really like it. I'm returning it and going to try to find it in a different finish. I definitely do NOT recommend this one!PS. Always use blow dryers with a GFCI-protected outlet whenever possible. Most of the burning and melting and definitely the fires you see in blow dryer reviews would be avoided when using a protective outlet! Just some friendly advice!

reviewTitle: Dries well but paint chips off!
reviewDescription: My old hair drier finally stopped working after about 17 years and I decided to purchase this Conair dryer after reading lots of reviews. I have to say that the drying aspect lives up to the hype; it has multiple settings and temps and doesn’t cause as much frizz as a regular hair dryer.Cons: it does not come with a diffuser and try old diffuser did not fit so I had to order another one. Secondly, the paint started chipping off the handle after less than 2 weeks. I could not figure out why I kept finding white flecks on my face and in my hair. After several days of this I carefully examined the dryer and discovered the faulty coating. Very displeased with this aspect!

reviewTitle: White flecks from the housing on your hands.
reviewDescription: I really like this blow dryer and it seems to be less harsh on my fine hair than other dryers I've had.  I've had the unit since the end of January and am now getting white flecks on my hands after after drying my hair.  It's very annoying and messy.  I've wiped down the housing, only to have the flecks start again.  It's almost like the housing is shedding.  I don't have any caustic substances on my hands, so it must be an inferior casing material that the drier is made out of.  I think I will return the unit for exchange.
Bought this in August of 2023 and heard a pop yesterday and now it’s dead…Loved it while it lasted but I don’t want to buy again because of this.
I’ve used it a few times to dry my hair. Great for the price but paint chips like crazy and gets all in your hair.
I liked that it was sleek looking, very easily dries, not too noisy. However, it didn't come with a concentrator piece as it advertised.

reviewTitle: Shortest Power Cord in the History of Mankind
reviewDescription: The dryer is very light and easy to use, however the power may be insufficient for people with thick hair.  It's also very quiet - although part of that is likely a result of the lack of fan speed.  The power outlet in my bathroom is towards the back of the wall and the cord is barely long enough to use the dryer.  The outlet is on my left, so I have to turn and face the wall to dry the right side.  Crazy!  I guess they figured they could save a lot on production costs by cutting the cord in half.
I needed this hair dryer asap and got it quickly. However, I threw packing away without trying it first. I would rate it anemic at best.
Works for drying hair that’s about it. Not a bad hair dryer but white paint started flaking off everywhere after about a month. It was messy and annoying.

I love the look and design of this hair dryer. However the heat is lacking. It has a Hot, Warm,Cool setting, but I can't tell much difference between the Hot/Cool. The cord is also very short. I stand at my bathroom vanity to dry my hair, and it's come unplugged twice already. I will be keeping it, just wish I'd read this about it before I purchased.

The nozzle attachment does not stay on which tends to be annoying. I've had it for while now and bits of white are falling off around my bathroom.  I guess it is the coating from the hair dryer's color??

As a license cosmetologist I've use several different blow dyers.I purchased this to use at a memory care facility it's very lite  not heavy at all. My problem is it doesn't get hot enough  to dry the residents hair and also the cord is short..
I love the hairdryer and how it dries my hair but the cord is way too short.

It dries my hair, the dryer is light weight, it’s not easily stashed for travel though, and also the white matted paint on the handle is peeling off. Every time I use it there are flakes of paint or whatever is the matted material on the handle portion of the hairdryer, gets all over my hand, and also all over whatever I handle after I use the hairdryer! So aggravating. I hope it’s lead free paint!

This is a good dryer for someone doing a quick basic blower. However, it’s not good for “blow outs”. It doesn’t get hot enough. And the switches are in a terrible place, so I’m constantly stopping to fix the settings. Fixing the switch settings make me have to stop blow drying and the attachment falls off. And, the cord is very short. So frustrating!

reviewTitle: It didnt work well for me
reviewDescription: It's good but takes time to dry out hair and they are still wet. So can't say. It's my first time using a blow-dryer so I will use it 2 or 3 more timed to update its operation.
The heat was strong, but the hair dryer lacked in air flow. I was underwhelmed with the air power. Would not recommend for anyone with thicker hair, takes too long to dry. Short cord. Light weight.

I did not like the weak motor on this model. It took me much longer to dry my long hair. The speed is weak as well. However, I decided to keep it to dry my  fresh acrylic paintings only. Otherwise I would have returned it.  I do not recommend this model at all.

I bought this about 6 months ago and unfortunately I have to throw it away. It works fine however the paint is coming off whenever I use it. I didn’t realize what was causing the white flakes in my hair and was thinking it was dandruff when it was the white paint chips.

I have used the same blow dryer for the last 7 years and it just broke on me. I bought this one, it is sleek, the heat and cool settings worked great, however, its power is very low in comparison the the other one I used. I have returned this item.
Nice dryer but not enough of a "blast" cimming out.  Took a while to dry hair.  Returned.  Good returns by seller.....thanks for that !!

Dryer's white finish flakes off on your hands as you dry your hair. The tiny flakes fall on your head as you finish drying your hair, and you need a couple extra minutes just to pick the f*ng flakes off of your hair. Not fun.
This is the weakest hair dryer I’ve ever used.  No power to it. It also seems to cause static electricity in my hair.

reviewTitle: SENT USED AND PRODUCT IS NOT GOOD
reviewDescription: I bought new but not what I recieved. Clearly been opened then thrown in box and taped shut. This is third item bought NEW that clearly is not.As for the item the power buttons are placed on the handle in such a way that I am constantly hitting them and turning the dryer off. There is a learning curve on how to hold it so this doesn't happen, but it is ackward and uncomfortable. Problably why it was returned before I recieved it. I was going to keep but had it few weeks and still is frustrating. Other thing is it doesn't get very hot or blows much air out. I have very short fine hair so drying it is usually a snap, but with this it is a chore.

reviewTitle: Loud and the color flakes off
reviewDescription: Bought this a year ago, and my husband thinks it's the loudest hair dryer I have ever owned. The handle is also a bit long which makes it difficult to style with.The thing I dislike most about it is the white finish is flaking off and I end up with tiny white flecks on my face.

Worked fine when we first got it. After three months it just quit working...just makes funny noise and motor gets extremely hot....not the air cause there is no air...but the motor itself is burning up.
Unless you want to stand right next to your outlet the entire time you are drying your hair, go with a different dryer with a regular length cord.
This doesn't blow hot air it's warm at best even when on the hot setting. It's not powerful either just a light breeze on your head.

I own a Conair 1875 hair dryer. I bought it from Costco. It's probably over 5 yrs old. My son used it and dropped it. The nozzle cracked so I can no longer use the attachment. I bought this to replace the old one.Description sounded great. When it arrived and I picked up the box, it was so light,  I honestly thought they sent me an empty box. I opened the box, the hair dryer is in there in good condition. The body is made of cheap plastic material. Kind of reminds me of a toy. I plugged it in, and it does not have the same power as my old one.  It works, but don't waste your money.

reviewTitle: Not Hot and Not a Quick Dry
reviewDescription: It doesn’t blow “Hot” air on any setting. It also takes forever to dry my hair because the High setting is more like a medium power. Not impressed. It looks nice but this is more of a hair dryer for the elderly.

reviewTitle: Frustrating! Needs a redesign on the attachment!
reviewDescription: So frustrating!! The attachment nozzle falls off continuously as I blow dry my hair. The nozzle needs a tighter fit!
It gets the job done but if you actually want to do a blow out. Get a better blow dryer

reviewTitle: Loved it for the first little while then nope
reviewDescription: This hairdryer started out AMAZING. Great power, dried quickly, etc. then shortly after it started having so many issues. Doesn't dry as well, the pain is chipping off everywhere and seriously MELTS off even with low heat. It's horrible. I dry my hair and it leaves my hair, clothes and hands covered in white flakes after. Do not recommend unless you want something for only a couple months.

It doesn’t get hot at all, maybe lukewarm at best. I have very fine hair and it usually only takes a few minutes to completely dry it with other hair dryers, but it took double the amount of time with this dryer. Very disappointed! The only good thing I can say about it is that it pushes out a lot of air on the high setting!
The electrical cord on this blowdryer is very short compared to others.  It works fine.

This looks a little better than it really is.  I usually am very happy with Conair, and as I said the dryer is nice, but unless your standing close to the outlet, you'll find it easier to use if you get an extension cord and just keep it with the dryer.

Bought this to replace my dryer that had burned out.  If you are left handed as I am, This product is not for you ! Holding in your left hand the on/off switch cuts off ALL the time otherwise it works fine
I bought this on sale and I’m glad it wasn’t full priced. I would be bummed. It’s cute, but man it is not powerful at all. I had a very old conair with the same wattage that was very powerful.
This is supposed to be 1850 watts but it does not have that much power, so I have to use the high setting all the time. It gets the job done but spend an extra $10 bucks and upgrade.
As a hair dryer it did everything it was suppose to and I particularly liked the cold shot feature.  However, it just stopped working the other day -- very disappointing.

reviewTitle: One side of plug is larger!
reviewDescription: This blow dryer is decent. It's nice that it has the hot, warm, cool and high and low settings, but I feel like it doesn't get that hot, so it takes a little longer to dry my hair. The most annoying thing is that one side of the plug is larger, so it doesn't fit inside the outlet in my bathroom.One cool thing I noticed is that there's a small loop so you can hang it. Don't think I've seen that before in a blow-dryer, but I also haven't really been looking much at blow-dryers. I haven't got anything to hang it on though, so can't really say how well it works.
Hard to hold and move comfortably without changing the controls inadvertently.  Plug keeps coming out of the outlet as I use it.  Power is fine.

Nice little blow dryer but I feel my small travel one have more air output power.Won't purchase this again.  Does not mean that others would not appreciate.I have a lot of hair and it is thick.  So.. it's not an ideal blow dryer for me.  I will keep it and use it until I can get a new one.

While it is light weight and does dry pretty well, the power cord is too short.  An extra foot of cord would have me want to keep this dryer.  It never mentions the cord length in any description.  The amount of wind the fan puts out seems to be seek compared to an almost identical dryer this one replaced.

I got this hair dryer because my old dryer was shorting out the GFI plug every time I used it. Figured it was time to replace it. This dryer is lightweight and it dries my hair in the time it takes to sing "Nectarine (Part Two)" by Mike Doughty. I wish the cord was about a foot longer, and the air doesn't seem to get as hot as my old hair dryer, but maybe my old hair dryer was blowing hotter air because it was dying, and the only way it could think of to let me know that, was by shorting out the GFI plug.So, in conclusion, lightweight, short cord, dries your hair in 2:26 minutes.

I like the number of settings on this dryer - separate buttons for heat and airflow.  I wish the airflow were stronger, though.  Also, I'd prefer a glossy finish instead of the matte one that's used because glossy doesn't collect dirt nearly so easily.
This  hair dryer is good but certainly not a professional one.
Very lightweight and comfortable to hold, really shortens drying time. A bit loud if someone is still sleeping when you are doing your hair!
I like everything about this but 1 thing, the cord is too short.
She loves the controls on it better than her previous dryer.

reviewTitle: Good dryer, with two small faults.
reviewDescription: Overall this is a nice hair dryer. It looks good. It sounds good (not too loud). But it is not as powerful as my previous hair dryer. (Maybe blows at 80% or so of the power one would expect) Still gets the job done for me as I don't have a lot of hair to dry. Also, as some have noted, the power cord is a bit on the short side. It really should be a couple of feet longer in my opinion. Other than that, no complaints.

I was amazed at how fast this was shipped. I was so grateful because I use my hairdryer everyday. It is lightweight ,which is nice when you have to hold it for awhile due to my very thick hair. I bought because the ceramic is supposed to be better for your hair and it was a good price. I would recommend it.

reviewTitle: Dries your hair, but the coating comes off
reviewDescription: Conair is a brand that has been around for a long time. I like this hair dryer for its power and heat, but after about 2 weeks of using it, the white paint/coating on the handle is flaking off. I've tried to use a rag and get off as much as possible, but it keeps coming. It's not a show-stopper for me, but just be aware that if you see white flakes on your hands, it's shedding! Otherwise, I do like it. I'm sure it will all wear off eventually.
Is it worth it for the money? Yes; its quiet and dries well. However, be prepared for white paint chipping off of it and getting everywhere.
This dryer came on time and was exactly as described.  It works good and isn't as loud as my old one was.  Works good.
Lots of different heat and blow settings. Doesn't suck my hair into the air intake.

reviewTitle: Conair 1875 blowdryer faulty part - Customer Service was PHENOMINAL
reviewDescription: WONDERFUL Customer Service from ConAir! I own a Conair 1875 blow dryer for over 20 years and loved the product. So I finally bought one for my teenage daughter for Christmas 2022! At 94 days of purchase the "Indicator light" came on, the warning manual says if this light comes on stop use immediately and contact a service center. Being I just purchased this for Christmas 3 months ago I went to Amazon. The warranty says good for 90 days (I was at 94 days, grrr). SO I called Conair. The women that helped me from Conair was WONDERFUL! She spoke perfect English, was helpful and Kind! Didn't question it being over 90 days, and set me up with a replacement right away! I am in the process of receiving that replacement now! I had to cut the cord and sent in photos, but they are sending me a new one! It was probably the BEST Customer Service I have ever experienced with a situation like this! KUDOS to ConAir! Great Company! I would definitely purchase again and many other ConAir products in my life! MOST Wonderful Experience!
I'm no expert in hair things but it dries my hair fast. I like the nozzle attachment and have it on there permanently. Heat settings are good and speeds are fine for my Asian hair.
I like this product because it looks nice and quick dry my hair.
I like the low low heat setting
A lot lighter than other blow dryers. Chord isn’t very long so less likely to tangle up.
Works
Easy to use three speeds and three heat types. Easy to store and very good quality and easy to use
This hair dryer has good drying options, has sufficient drying power and I appreciate the lightweight ease for use in styling and drying my hair.  The price is fair.
This product has helped with the amount of frizz after blowing hair dry. It does not take as long to dry hair compared to the old conair I owned.

We bought this to replace a two-year old Jinri that had a plastic-on-plastic sound because the fan blade was hitting the sides.This wattage on this model is a bit low, which we wanted - we have an old house with overstretched circuit breakers.  But perhaps because of the "Ionic" function, it dries impressively well, without a ton of heat.In fact, I was concerned... this might be one of the coolest driers I've ever used.  But it dries impressively well, and my hair doesn't feel like it's getting fried.And after the Jinri, I really appreciate the no-nonsense layout of the rocker switches.  Our last unit required the switches to be "centered" in order to turn it off, which was always a nuisance.  This drier puts "Off, Medium, and High" in an intuitive order, and has never required me to look at the switches.Considering the price, this drier is an amazing value, especially if you're looking for modest wattages.
I absolutely love this hair dryer! It is powerful or gentle when you want it to be. I’ve had this for over a year and it is still working like it’s brand new!

My old Conair hair dryer started smelling like something was burning so thought I should replace it. Have had several Conair dryers over the years and they have always given me good service. I like the fact that this one is lightweight, not too loud, and has several settings for temperature and speed. I'm very happy with it and would recommend it.

Because of its size this hair dryer is the best home hair dryer.Plenty of power. You can toggle between hot air and cool air by pressing the blue button which quickly stops the heat. It is a full size hair dryer. I am pleased with this dryer.
As dryers come and go, I am pleased with this one.  Has two settings and a cooling button.  Easy to clean, in case you get makeup on it from finishing your face before drying hair!  hahaha
gift for my granddaughter to go to college

reviewTitle: light weight but dries like something much more substantial
reviewDescription: I like this hair dryer a lot.  It's light weight but dries like a champ.  I especially appreciated the user instructions, which include a table with heat and airspeed combinations for different hair types.  It would be nice if this hairdryer were a little more compact.
Excelente calidad

This blow dryer not only looks pretty but works well. I have been using it for several months now and have had absolutely no issues with it. It doesn't have super high blast power like some do, but I typically only use low to medium air flow anyway, and if I feel like I need a faster dry, the high speed has plenty of air power. I like that it's lighter than my previous hair dryers, and that's one of the reasons I purchased this model. If I want to take a full size hair dryer when traveling, it ads barely any weight to my suitcase.

reviewTitle: Perfect lower speed for thin hair!
reviewDescription: I had a Conair 1875 that lasted me nearly 40 years! I loved it because I have fine hair and need the lower speed air flow and temp. I bought a Conair Infinity Pro and it was too much for my hair. Nearly blew my hair right off my scalp! So I looked more online. When I saw the complaints about the fan speed being too low or that it took forever to dry hair I knew this was the hairdryer for me!  I just tried it out and it's just like my old trusty Conair 1875. The lower speed combined with cool temp is perfect for a peri-menopausal woman who has thinning hair & hot flashes at the drop of a dime.

My last hairdryer that I had for years was a Conair and even though it still ran, I decided to replace it. Conairs are resonably priced and I really like the two dryer speeds and three heat settings so I bought this one. It dries my hair quickly, is lighter than my old hairdryer and is easy to use. The only thing that could improve it is instead of a rubber ring to hang it from which does not look like it would last, would be  a metal ring that is attached to the hard plastic body, but that would cost more to produce. I wrapped a leather cord around the handle just above the plastic ring to hang it from a wall hook. That works for me and I am still very happy with my purchase.
I like the fact that it has a cut off switch in the handle for the heater coils.  I can turn  the heat on and off as I use it.  Makes it easy to make sure you don't durn your hair.

Can't say I've tried a ton of hair dryers but this was one great and left me with no complaints. I have super thick long hair that can be difficult to try, but this worked pretty well and it was easy to use since it wasn't too heavy.

I love this blow dryer! The only thing that I wish there was was a longer cord! But other than that the blow dryer works perfectly and comes with everything that is listed in the description. Highly recommend!

Why 5 stars? Because my daughter’s old hairdryer died and this one arrived quickly and blew warm air on her tern head putting an end to yet another crisis. Thank you hairdryer that saved our household peace (for now)
Loved it!!

I absolutely love this Hair Dryer! It is wonderful to use, and looks great at the same time. Very nicely styled, easy to use, and dries my hair better than any dryer I've had before. and best of all, it is not super noisy!! Much quieter than any Hair Dryer I have used.
Light weight, very powerful.I'm very happy & highly recommend

I bought this for a friend, who absolutely loved it. Said it was everything they wanted, and way better than their old one that ran its course. I don't know the particulars, so I can't describe the temperatures, etc. But my friend raved about it and went on about how this feature was better than the old one, and that feature was better than the old one... So for me, it was money well spent.

reviewTitle: Dryer is great- outside is not
reviewDescription: I keep meaning to come leave this review. This morning I’m extra annoyed because I’m in a hurry and the hair dryer slows me down. Why does a hair dryer slow me down? Not because it doesn’t dry my hair, but because for months the PAINT on the outside of the hair dryer has been chipping off and ends up in my hair. You know how difficult it is to get tiny spots of white paint out of dark hair? It’s difficult. And extremely annoying. I bought this hair dryer after my last one finally kicked the bucket. It was the same model, just in orange and was wonderful. This one is also wonderful, except the dang paint. I don’t know if they just didn’t test this, or if mine is defective, but gahhhh it is so annoying.

reviewTitle: Don’t buy unless you want paint chips all over your hands
reviewDescription: Product is lightweight, cheaply priced (get what you pay for I guess), and does operate and dry your hair well.Purchased for the color and weight. And I did like that the price was low too. But 3 months into using it on and off (I still had my old hair dryer I liked), the paint began chipping off and my hand was white with paint chips/flecks. 😒 It was passed the return timeline, and it took me another couple months to make time to get the contact info for the company.. and then the time never came to reach out to them to get “help” whether return, etc. and then it seemed too long so whatever. I did get this dryer first for my daughter - fit her aesthetic, and she rarely blow dries her hair so I had not seen this paint chipping yet. So I bought one for myself since it was cute and worked well and was lightweight! Ugh.. regret it now. It’s been a year now and I keep forgetting to get another hair dryer, until today, I am making myself do it. At the same time am writing this review. Disappointed bc it’s an ok hair dryer otherwise.

Cheap plastic with no power. Took me three times as long to dry my hair with this dryer than with my older Conair Infiniti Pro, which I just ordered, twenty-four hours after receiving the cheap plastic version. You get what you pay for. Spend a little extra for a better product right off the bat and you won't have to go through what I am just to have dry, frizz-free hair!

I thought my blow dryer was on its way out, so I ordered this one. Then I got my blow dryer to work so I put this one in the closet and it’s been sitting there for about six months. Well now my dryer finally went and when I took this one out I was very disappointed to see that the cool setting is not cool at all. It’s just warm. I always dried my hair on cool. There is a button that you could press to get cool air but you have to hold it down. I have very long hair and it takes my hair a while to dry and holding this cool button down the entire time ends up making my whole hand hurt. Unfortunately I can’t return it anymore because it’s been so long, so I have to go out and buy another blow dryer. They really should make the cool setting actually cool.

I have had this blow dryer and not even 7 months and it stopped working. I've tested it and I've tried different outlets I've done everything that you should do to test an appliance and it's not working. Don't waste your money on this you'll have to buy another blow dryer within a few months.
Bought this product under a year ago and it randomly stopped working. Been trying to contact customer service and this specific seller and no response. Id invest in another hair dryer if I were you

Every single time I dry my hair, my hands and fingers are full of paint chips.  Pictures taken are paint remaining after I washed hands once.  Also you can see how the paint is flaking off entire blow dryer

Overall, I'm unhappy with the Conair Double Ceramic Hair Dryer, 1875W Hair Dryer with Ionic Conditioning and it has nothing to do with its function and everything to do with design. I've owned and used this product for the past 6 months and have used it at least 2-3 times a week in that period of time.PRO: It works and dries my hair adequately.CONS:1. Paint has started to peel and flake of off the handle and body of the unit in the last few months, leaving small specks of white paint all over my hands and clothes and also attaching to other surfaces (i.e. my hair brush, the surface of my dresser...etc.)2. The plastic nozzle attachment that is intended to channel the air to my brush does not function. It's easily knocked off the end and spins endlessly; therefore, I've stop using it because it never stays in the correct position or falls off altogether.3. The cord is just slightly too short, making it hard to dry my hair when not using a counter level outlet.
I’ve had it for 7 months, use it 2-3 times per week. Today the reset buttons wouldn’t reset. Junk.

reviewTitle: Paint flaking off handle and makes a mess
reviewDescription: After using this daily for 10 months, I noticed that the white paint on the handle has flaked off. Gets on hair and hands, and is scattered all over the wire. The paint is not easy to wash off either. It adheres to surfaces and does not come off easily. I store it in a dry room as well. Such a waste. I plan to buy a new one that does not have this issue. If I find a solution to contain the paint I will keep it. In the mean time, I have this use it carefully to avoid paint flaking onto my hair. Additionally, the hair dryer developed a high-pitched yet subtle shrieking sound, also 10 months in.You might have to zoom in with the photo. The white specks on the wire are paint, and you will see the patches of flaked-off paint on the handle.

I wanted a ceramic dryer that’s not too expensive, so this apparently is it. I was originally just going to buy the regular sized one, until I read a review, saying the traveling one is more powerful. How could that be?! I was so intrigued I ordered both for comparison. The body of the traveling one is just a little shorter, with a folding handle, see photo for comparison. Other reviewers also complained that the regular unit has bad placement of on/off buttons. Although I personally didn’t find that to be a problem, I took a side-by-side photo for reference. Although the wattage is completely the same between the two units. Oddly, the traveling unit does feel a little more powerful than the regular unit! I don’t get it, but I’m keeping the travelling unit and returning the regular one.
Works well
Light weight. Works well - not too hot.  I wish the cord were longer
I love this dryer.  One thing,  though,  the on/off switch is in the way, so when I'm holding it and drying my hair, I constantly hit the off ... it's annoying but it's an excellent dryer
It's a bit big in size. Good heat and great for the price, but wish it was smaller. Not suitable for travelling!
This dryer seems well constructed and does it's job. It may be my imagination but it seems slightly weaker in velocity than the on it replaced.
Good enough hair dryer, the cord could stand to be a bit longer, even standing inclose proximity to mirror the cord pulls out of the wall.
Weak air and it takes long to dry my hair.
I like this blow dryer and it definitely heats up very well. Only con I had was I didn’t get the attachment to it but that’s okay.
Finally took it out of the box. Works well but the cord is really short. Would’ve sent it back because of this, but I waited too long to use it so it’s past the date of return.

Feels like this blow dryer has zero power. Not only does it not blow a good volume of air, it gets Luke warm. Sadly I can’t return it because I already threw away the box so this is just going to sit under my sink until I eventually get sick of looking at it and throw it away

reviewTitle: Spend $10 more and buy a real hair dryer
reviewDescription: This is one of the few occasions where Amazon really did me wrong.  Based on the reviews this would be a great hair dryer but in reality it is an anemic hotel type dryer that does nothing.  Spend $10 more and buy an infinity pro...

I have only had this hair dryer for one year and the paint has been chipping off.  It gets all over everything.  My brushes are covered in it, anything near it in the drawer gets covered.  It is even getting in my hair.  I initially couldn’t tell where it was coming from but it’s an outer coating of paint that is slowing chipping off.  Very disappointed in Conair.

I bought this to replace a Conair that I had had for years that finally died. I thought I was getting a great deal on an exact replacement.  I was wrong.  This is a cheap feeling plastic, the cord is too short.  The warm setting is pretty much room temperature.  The hot setting is not enough to actually do anything.  And it has nowhere near the air flow of my last one, even on high.  I've tried it a couple of times and absolutely hate it.  Will be returning.
I’ve used for like a month and it broken

I found these tiny flecks of white on my hands and face for an embarrassingly long time before discovering their source: the handle of this cheaply made blow dryer. It also wasn't the greatest in terms of drying power  and definitely not good for traveling due to the whole flaking off white paint thing. It's not the lightest weight, either. Overall, I'd advise you pass on this one.

reviewTitle: Trips breaker and cannot be used.
reviewDescription: I purchased as a gift for my granddaughters birthday in February but  made the purchase in December so we could transport over Christmas and have it waiting for the birthday.  The item continues to trip the circuit breaker in multiple rooms and now in my own home.  The window to return is closed and now I am stuck with a useless piece of junk.

reviewTitle: Do not buy . Conair has horrible customer service
reviewDescription: Stopped working and Conair won’t replace it.

Within 3 months of using this hairdryer, the white started flaking off in my hand. Then it started flaking off in tiny bits and blowing into my hair and all over me. It’s hard to get the tiny flakes out of my hair and off if my skin. Now I’m buying a different dryer. What a waste of money!
Very disappointed in this product. Was used once or twice a week and died after 14 months.

I usually swear by this product I have actually bought one and gifted her to my mom! Unfortunately mine just started sparking while drying my hair ( and I just got finished drying my daughter's hair).  I un-plugged it and it made another spark. It's going great in the garbage and I'm not buying another one from this company!

I hate this hair dryer more than anything. It has a tiny short cord which restricts your movement. The only thing I can say about it is it will dry your hair. The cold shot doesn’t get cold enough. Compared to past driers it doesn’t make my hair as soft or shiny. It’s a waste of money

reviewTitle: Paint flaked off in less than a year
reviewDescription: I bought this hairdryer in Jan 23. One morning in december I noticed white flakes all over my hair and face. Upon further examination I found the source was a faulty paint job on the hair dryer. It was all over my hands as well. So frustrating it didn’t even last a year!!!

reviewTitle: Stopped working after just a few months
reviewDescription: If I'd reviewed this dryer right after I bought it, I'd have given it 5 stars. But just a few months in, it's stopped working. I've tried every possible way to reset it, including in outlets I know are working, but no luck. Now it's a 1 star and headed for the trash.

reviewTitle: Leaks scary white plastic "powder" from handle
reviewDescription: It gets a NO STARS rating because of the short return time, no way to contact the seller after purchase and clearly inferior and potentially dangerous product. We recently noticed a strange white "powder" or "dust" coming from the switches and buttons in the handle and where the power cord attaches! Since we usually dry our hair with our eyes closed we don't know how long this stuff has been leaking and or how long we have been breathing it in! We won't use it again that 's for sure. The are a lot of inexpensive hair dryers out there and we recommend you get a different one!

Not impressed with his hairdryer. Output for drying your hair is minimal I’m just doesn’t offer a good performance. Unfortunately I don’t have the box anymore. Otherwise I would most definitely return this hairdryer. Extremely disappointed and not impressed at all. I have short fine hair would have worked for me.
I wish i could give 0 stars! Buttons get pushed while you’re holding it. It is under powered & takes forever to dry my even short hair.
I bought this in Feb 2023. It worked for about a year and now just makes a horrible noise when blowing air. I cannot recommend this.

It took me a while to figure out why I was covered in white specs every time I dried my hair - The material on the handle of this is disintegrating! I've only had it a few months, and I'm going to have to replace it. What a crazy thing. I'd be covered in white specs, and it'd blow into my hair, which obviously isn't desirable, lol. It's the plastic of the unit breaking down!

reviewTitle: White paint coating is chipping off.
reviewDescription: The dryer itself works great. I’m in my 60’s and have had many dryers, but I’ve never had one lose a layer of paint as I used it! I paid $60 in Feb. ‘23, not the price has dropped to $21 — probably because of the terrible paint coating. I’m too cheap to throw it away but will spend some time with a scrub pad to remove as much loose paint as I can. Unbelievable. I’ve never written a review before, but this needs one. I’ve bought Conair in the past and been pleased, but they should do a recall on this product.

Love(d) the white finish. It is aesthetically pleasing. Buuuuuut, I bought it nine months ago and now the top layer white paint finish on the blow dryer is flaking off. Not just the handle, but the entire dryer. I have teeny tiny white paint flakes all over my hand, the counter, the floor, inside the cabinet. Bummed.

This hair dryer is not the best. First of all, the cord is so short that it comes out of the wall at least once during the drying process. Second, the airflow on "high" is what my old Conair hair dryer would put out on "low". Last, after several uses, the white plastic on the dryer itself is flecking off each time. At first I thought I had terrible dandruff...turns out, it's just plastic particles. I would never buy this product again.

reviewTitle: Not so powerful LOTS lf ceramic peeling
