reviewDescription: I bought it about 6 months ago. It isn’t very powerful but just enough for what I need it for. But the WORST is the excess peeling of the material it is made. It sticks to my hands all the time and ends up in my hair, my face, my clothes. I wouldn’t recommend buying it.

Perhaps seniority is why this has so many good reviews; people settling.  Old faithful crapped out so I purchased this based on reviews.  At the top speed, I can still breathe with more force a foot away than this has 2 inches away.  Decent space heater but not hair dryer.

I purchased this hair dryer in February, 2023.  It works, but the paint is coming off in tiny white flecks...landing on the black electrical cord, my hands, my hair, my face, and anything else nearby.  I'll be purchasing a different hair dryer (are they all made in China?) today.
there are definitely better products out there for the price- this is NOT a great purchase in my opinion. My hair is thick and this does NOT work well.

reviewTitle: At least it blows hot air
reviewDescription: This blower is the weakest I’ve ever purchased and used for that matter. Even on the highest setting it’s pretty pitiful. Skip this one and find another.
It makes noise but lacks air velocity. I returned it.

I purchased this at the beginning of December and the paint starting flaking off after two months, in February. I can’t grab the handle without getting a bunch of tiny flecks of white paint all over my hand. They are all over the drawer I keep this in. Compared to my old Joy hair dryer, this thing puts out far less air, too, so it takes almost twice as long to dry my hair. I am so disappointed in this purchase that I will not be buying another Conair product. Now I have to drop more money on something that actually works and won’t fall apart like this piece of junk.

I have thin hair which is easy and fast to dry. I thought this blow dryer would be perfect, especially how light it is. But when the air barely blew my hair, I was surprised so I returned it. I guess you get what you pay for.

reviewTitle: Wish the high setting blew a little more forcefully.
reviewDescription: My old Conair Blow dryer (had it for 17 years and it just died) blew with more force so it takes a bit longer to dry my hair now. The cool shot works like a dream.
works well to dry my hair but the cord was way shorter than any of my previous blowdryers
Great little blow dryer; it’s not super powerful or very high heat, but for the price it’s good!
Great dryer for the price. The only thing is the cord is extremely short, not much reach at all. Which is why I am giving it 4 stars

I really like this  light weight hair dryer and would give all 5 stars, but I am having a slight issue with the dryer nozzle not staying on hair dryer. I appears nozzle isn't fitting tightly on dryer, but I really like the power on my thick hair...doesn't take very long to dry hair (great power)
It has a weird smell when you’re blowing the hair straight but it does what it needs to and looks good

My previous Conair hairdryer finally died, so I looked for another inexpensive hair dryer.  This is what I ordered and I am happy with it.  It is hot, is fairly power, has both speed and temperature selections and is lightweight.  I especially like that is it the quietest hair dryer I have owned.  The only issue I have is the cord.  It is about 18" shorter than the cord on my last dryer.  My outlet is on the left, I am right handed, and my sink is a little ways down the counter.  I have already pulled the plug out of the wall twice!  So, one star deducted. I am keeping it due to price and other features.
It works fine. The others are right that the cord is short, but if your plug is next to your vanity or dresser, you’re fine.
Hair dryer works great, but the cord is short and comes unplugged easily

reviewTitle: Good drying power, but not the best!
reviewDescription: It’s easy to use. Lightweight and convenient. The drying power is good but could have been better. Serves the purpose for me to blow dry my wet hair quite well.Pretty much satisfied with the product so far!

I can't seem to find anything close to my older model Conair hair dryer. I like the look and feel of this one, but that's about it. I have middle-length, fine hair and it typically doesn't take much to dry my hair. However, this hair dryer is just okay. I keep it on the "low" option with the "hot" setting and it's anything but. I would say it's lukewarm at best. The difference in speeds it's pretty dramatic. High is really fast with just warmish air coming out, which is quite a disappointment. It takes much longer to dry my hair than normal. The only benefit to this is the nozzle of the hair dryer doesn't get hot and you can put it away without it having to cool off. I might return this, but it's my 3rd hair dryer (different make/model) and I just don't feel like going through the hassle of returning it.
This is a good hair dryer but it only lasted a little over a year.
I love that it’s not loud, but it’s not a very strong hair dryer.
using it but cord isn't long enough to move comfortably
Paid $20 and it lasted 14 month before it stopped working.
Dries quicker and is quieter than my old one.

reviewTitle: Good but only for a few months
reviewDescription: It stopped working after a while and didn’t have enough power
Not soo strong and fast ,but works good
Did the job but stopped heating up a year after I bought it. I also don’t blow dry my hair very often so it’s kind of a bummer. Can’t really complain for $20 tho.

I chose this one because this was the same brand as the one I'm replacing.  I don't like it as well.  On the "cool" setting, it still blows warm.  I can't exactly say why I don't like it; the switches flip easily when your holding it be the handle, even though you don't intend to flip a switch.  I'd say it's adequate but not outstanding.
Easy to use, doesn’t run hot or make hair frizzy

Oh my goodness, I LOVE this hair dryer! It is so lightweight and easy to set up. I love that it comes with an extra nozzle to really direct the heat. It has good power and heat and dries my hair within five minutes. I love that it has three different heating settings and power settings. Perfect for travel!

I had to purchase this after my last conair finally died after 8 YEARS. The buttons are very easy to navigate to low & high, and I love the 3 temperatures with the cold shot available to set your styles. I don't know what reason anyone would give this a bad review as I'm very picky & I think it's great. And I've had no problem with scratches and I'm hard on stuff. I highly recommend!
I love this dryer for its style, the ability to change the controls and the quietness when using. I have been using Conair products for many years.

When my old hairdryer finally blew out, I bought this one because it has ions and dries hair quickly without damaging it.  I have been impressed how well it works and my hair feels soft and silky.  It has a good price point as well.
I love this hairdryer it doesn’t get too hot, but it drives very fast and doesn’t damage my hair like other hairdryers

reviewTitle: Great hair dryer for its price.
reviewDescription: Thumbs up for this dryer. It has 3 settings for both temperature and power as well as a diffusing attachment.
Several temp and air flow selections available.  Dries my fine hair quickly.  Not really a travel dryer.  The weight isn't particularly light or heavy.  Does what it is supposed to do.
El blower es bueno con un buen protector térmico. El cable es corto. La boquilla la encuentro grande.  Me tarde menos en el secado. Lo recomiendo.
The hairdryer is great, beautiful design and dries your hair so well. I like the cool level myself, terrific power. Highly recommend it to anyone.
The paint started flaking off on to my hands after a year of use. Need to get another one now that’s made of plastic without paint on it…

The day i got this i waited to use it the next day, i showered my girls 2 & 3 yr olds and comb out the hair and used the blow dryer for the first time and out of no where it stop working.Ok i let it cool off and i disconnect it.Right now as i am writing this i have my girls in the restroom to dry there hair before bedtime and now it doesn’t work at all.This would have been my second time  using it but after the first time it stop working.Very disappointed

reviewTitle: White stuff melts all over your hands makes balls of white goo in your hair like dandruff
reviewDescription: My daughter was screaming at the top of her lungs about this horrible hair dryer getting white balls of plastic melted goo all over her hands and hair. Sure enough the material of this hair dryer is not the correct thing for this type of product and the handle melts apart with each use making a huge gooey nasty mess. And to think I had developed dandruff and that is why I had white balls in my hair. It gets worse with use. The second the balls start forming return it or throw in garbage before you end up with nasty white melted plastic all over your hands like my daughter did. It was a nightmare to remove. No soap takes off melted plastic. I would like to sue the manufacturer for this nightmare. Nobody should have to go through this drying their hair.

reviewTitle: The paint comes off and transfers everywhere!
reviewDescription: I am SO annoyed by this hair dryer!Pros:- lightweight- nice drying power- includes a temperature switch (hot, med, cool) and a power switch (high, low, off)Cons:- the cord doesn't wrap easily around it, nor does it retract (I haven't even been able to figure out how to wrap it a bit so it's less annoying in the cabinet)- the BIGGEST problem with this hair dryer is that the paint (white option) has increasingly started coming off and transferring to EVERYTHING! It sticks to my hands, to my brush handle, to the styling product bottles. And the worst part is how hard it is to get the small bits of paint to them come off. I am currently soaking my hairbrush in the hope that will help.I really regret getting this.

I thought I was upgrading my old hair dryer but this one does not put out enough heat and the controls are situated on the handle where I'm constantly turning it off by accident.  I went back to my old hair dryer for everyday use.

reviewTitle: Lasted two months and it’s failing
reviewDescription: Since purchasing, it’s been used about 30 hours (30 min a day).The low blower setting results in inconsistent flow and it is squeaking as if it’s starting to fail.The heat settings don’t always work, with extreme hot air coming out regardless of setting.  It appears to be more a temperature sensor issue as you can hear the load change as you change between cool, warm, hot.  Also, the cold blast works ok, at best….more of a cool trickle with continued hot air.I may have gotten a defective one, yet it worked when new.
The paint from the blow dryer flakes off including the inside. The white paint ends up everywhere. I don’t recommend this product.

Bought this hair dryer for my mother for christmas. Worked great until it completely stopped working this morning. I’ve had hair dryers for half the price last way longer than this one. Very disappointed.

reviewTitle: Hot, medium function doesn’t work anymore after three month.
reviewDescription: Now I can use only cool function.

reviewTitle: Extremely Poor Customer service. I'd avoid Conair
reviewDescription: I purchased this through Amazon. When I started noticing white flecks of something on my hands and hairbrush I finally realized it was from the blowdryer handle. Since the item was under warranty I was directed to Conair. I offered photos of my hands, hairbrush and the hair dryer handle that clearly show the problem but Conair wasn't interested. The response was to cut the cord of the item, send a pic, and then I'd receive a new dryer, likely in 10 days. I responded with the inconvenience of not having a hair dryer for 10 days. Conair did not care and did not want pics. Cut the cord, send the pic, wait 10 days. Okay. Not impressed. In fact, incredibly disappointed and will make sure I don't purchase Conair in the future. The paint shouldn't fleck off and if it does, they should view pics and send a replacement.

reviewTitle: TOO LARGE FOR TRAVELING- CORD IS SHORT
reviewDescription: This is fine for the price, it's powerful enough and has 3 heat levels. The cool level is  a bit warm for being cool. My maine concern is the short power cord. If you have long hair or the electric socket is not close to where you are standing in front of the mirror you will have an issue with this dryer.
I have chin length hair in this barely blows my hair around. I don’t end up with the same kind of body that I used to with my previous hairdryer. I should’ve returned it, but I was too lazy.
The hairdryer was decent for the price but only lasted less than two years before it stopped blowing hot air.

reviewTitle: Works great until it starts flaking
reviewDescription: This hair dryer is good for the money and works really well. Except about 2 months in the handle started flaking and I had white paint everywhere and it was really hard to get rid of

I have 2 other Conair dryers and needed another one for my gym bag. Not sure why but this one just doesn’t have any power. My other ones were about the same price but are a good bit more powerful. I gave really short hair so it is okay but I wish I would have sent it back instead of keeping it.

reviewTitle: Buttons/controls on handle not well placed
reviewDescription: I love the color and style of this hair dryer and love this brand. There are two drawbacks, one being the inconvenient placement of the control buttons on the handle which accidentally get pressed and switched while holding and using the dryer. The other is that the COOL selection is the same as the medium or warm selection, and the dryer does not blow COOL air which I use frequently. I would not be inclined to recommend this product, but maybe one of the same brand that is designed a little differently.

I bought the hair dryer 1.5 yr ago (Sept ‘22). The white paint on the handle recently bubbled up and started flaking off, making a mess all over my hands every time I use it. Came to reviews today just to check if others had the same issue, and yep. My hair dryer is kept in a bathroom without bath/shower, so maybe a room with higher humidity would cause it to happen quicker (as others have reported). I like the dryer otherwise, so I might try to sand or scrape the loose paint off to expedite its “shedding”…

Wanted to love this hair dryer, I have used Conair products all my life and this one replaced another Conair.  It does dry my hair quicker than my previous dryer, but the electric cable is 4 foot long, which is like 2 foot shorter than the other one.  This is crazy short in my opinion.  My brother did some electrician type stuff so I am going to ask him if he can switch out the old cord for this one.

I bought this hair dryer to replace the one that I had used for a long time. This hair dryer does not have the power like my old one does and I do not like it at all. I had to go and buy another hair dryer and will use this as a backup if needed. I would not recommend anyone buying this if they're looking for a high quality hair dryer.

reviewTitle: You get what you pay for
reviewDescription: At this price nobody should complain, and I'm not really.  ConAir makes a lot of different hair dryers in the same case, I guess.  The one this replaced burned out after 10-12 years.  This one blows hot enough, they say it does something with ions?  Yeah, your hair is softer and fluffier, but I like a more powerful blower, particularly on cold.  This one doesn't do that.  The fan motor is maybe 60% as powerful as my old ConAir.  My wife likes it, though, so I gave it to her.  I'll spend a little more next time and get something more powerful.  ConAir makes good stuff, I'm sure this one will last a long time.
The restart button is stuck, could be a fire hazard. Return is not finished. They are  not wanting to do a refund. Very disappointed!!!!
I've only had this a couple months and it turned off by itself I push the red and yellow button on the plug to reset it and it sparked out the back of the hair dryer. This thing is a fire hazard

I was trying to upgrade my over 10-year-old blow dryer with this one, but it absolutely sucks. It has barely any power, took twice as long to blow dry my hair.  I would return, but I unfortunately threw away the box.
Hair dryer was used infrequently and stopped working after 6 month. Junk.

reviewTitle: POOR PLACEMENT OF ON/OFF AND HEAT BUTTONS
reviewDescription: The dryer is lightweight and efficient, however, my fingers constantly hit the ON/OFF button turning it OFF and if I move my hand to another position my skinny fingers hit the heat selector button.  Really, Really Bad Design.
Just bought it 4 months ago and it doesn't work anymore. Amazon has closed the return window and returns cannot be made!

reviewTitle: Paint started chipping off into thousands of pieces everywhere
reviewDescription: DO NOT buy this. Only owned this for 3 months and it barely dries very well, and worst of all randomly 1 day after 3 months the paint all over the handle and near the buttons started flaking off into millions of pieces for no apparent reason. I keep it dry in and inside its box in my room 24/7 so there's no way this is due to water damage or anything else. The paint is chipping off into thousands of pieces and I have no clue why. Of course it happens 3 months after I bought it so now I can't refund. Awesome.

I don’t think I received a new dryer but maybe a refurbished one? Is that even a thing? I got it in October 2023, and have used it sparingly. I got it as an “upgrade” to replace the one I’ve been using for years.  It’s now been 2 months and it will not blow hot air. Don’t waste your money and stick to what you already have.
As others have stated, paint ships off every time I use this dryer. It gets all over my hand and forces me to rinse my hand off before continuing to style my hair. Worthless.
I bout 2 of these in the past 7 monthws. Each lasted 3 months an d then the faqn burned out. It smelled like an electrical component was on fire.  CANNOT

Don't let the price fool you.  This little hair dryer really packs a punch.  My hair is very thick and hard to dry but this dryer does a great job.  It is very light and doesn't pull on your arm.  The temperature settings are handy and not difficult to operate.  I'm happy and would purchase again.

I've been using an old version of this and brand for 15 years or more. I love the different temperature and high/ low settings, especially for my three year old.Having cool, and cold blast is the best!The attachment clips in instead of cupping on, for lack of better description, so I feel it's less likely to break/ stress the plastic, and won't fall off.
This is a nice light weight dryer that works well, dries your hair quickly. I have long thick curly hair so I added a diffuser to this dryer. Does a great job!

reviewTitle: Nice new hairdryer!  Very happy with the purchase.
reviewDescription: My old hairdryer was on its last leg.  I am really happy with the new Conair Ceramic Hair Dryer....it's lightweight and dries very well.  It's rather large for travel but I use it for home.

Great machine, Its good to keep in one's bathroom, not for travel since i consider its to standard in size to be a travel one.Does what it needs to do, and it has a cold air button to fix the hair after hot air.Sturdy good quality over all. I recommend it if your budget is low :)
It is perfect for traveling because of its light weight. I used it in Florida and the Ionic conditioning kept my hair from frizzing so I bought one for home.
VERY good hairdryer...high quality.does the jobVery nice action.versatile.Lightweight but solid. Would purchase again

reviewTitle: Didn’t know what I was missing
reviewDescription: I really didn’t need a new dryer but my stylist suggested to get one, but don’t pay a lot. So I got the Conair as that was my last one. Ceramic really does make a difference!  The old one will go to vacation house.

This hair dryer is light weight and seems like it doesn't blow very hard. It's quieter than my old expensive dryer. However it drys my hair great and quickly. Leaves my hair fluffy and full, not at all frizzy. Would buy again!

This is my second purchase of the dryer, that’s how much I love it. My first one I had for many years using daily. It’s extremely lightweight hard working has nice heat settings so you can go to cool it’s very pretty and aesthetic. It’s white but doesn’t get dirty and  easily wipeable.

This blow dryer is a waste. 1875 watts of what?  Doesn’t blow hot just warm. Doesn’t have enough strength to blow a lot of air. I had a 2000+ wattage before. I left it in Mexico so I got this until I can go back and get.  I am so sad to say this is a piece of junk.  Don’t waste your $$$
The drying aspect is fine. My issue is that after a couple of months the finish started to flake off, leaving white specks all over my hands and everything  else every time I use it.
İts too plastica not good

My hands are covered in flakes of white paint after drying my hair! The handle is literally flaking off! I have no idea why others do not report this. I’ve gone back to my old dryer.Also the cord is too short and the choices for air flow are too extreme, too low and too high with no middle option.
Not powerfull enough!!

I bought this dryer to replace my 15 yr. Old Conair. This one is very lightweight and dries my hair quicker! Highly recommend!Update: I changed my rating from 5 to 2 stars because the white paint around the handle is peeling which leaves white chips on your hand that transfer to your hair and face. Won’t come off of brush handle. Don’t get the white one!
The blower on this hair dryer is not strong enough for long hair.

reviewTitle: Paint comes off and short cord.
reviewDescription: The white paint is now chipping off. All over my hands, hair and clothes. Nozzle is fat and doesn’t direct properly for a good blow out. The cord is much shorter than my previous dryer. It kept getting caught on my drawer handle and none of my other beauty appliances do that. I’m super disappointed in this product.
This is not an 1875W as advertised. It does not blow enough air.
Takes me forever to dry my hair using this dryer. It is lightweight and quieter than most hair dryers but it just doesn't seem like it has enough power.
It’s good but not any different than other simple hairdryers. I do like the attachment that funnels the air in one direction though.

reviewTitle: not as lightweight as I'd hoped
reviewDescription: The features of the dryer are adequate, but I'm not sure it's particularly lightweight.  I have arthritis in the base of my thumbs and never had any trouble with the dryer I owned previous to this.  I bought this one based on it being lightweight, but the shape of the neck is different, and at first I thought I wasn't going to be able to hold it at all because the way the weight rested on my thumb was extremely painful.  I finally determined that if I got kind of a death grip around the top of the handle, I'd be able to use it without the pain, but it's awkward.I have very short hair, and I don't know if the fact that it seems to frizz on top a lot lately is related to this dryer or if my stylist cut it differently last time.  I think most people would be satisfied with this for a reasonably priced hair dryer.

This is one of 3 Conair hair dryers I purchased to replace one that died, and it’s the one I kept.Pros: cord length, weight, prevents hair from getting caught in the fanCons: the switch placement and type leaves me constantly pressing buttons I don’t mean to while blow drying, the speed & heat settings are painted on and I’m sure they’ll rub off in no time and I won’t remember what is what
The hair dryer is good for the price but the location of the high/low/off switch has me hitting it with my hand frequently when using.

White paint is chipping off of dryer and onto hands. I have tried washing down plastic part with damp cloth, but it is ongoing. It seems to get worse if I wash it off It is very frustrating and I feel product is defective. I will have to return or throw away. It takes several washings to remove paint from my hands.I will change rating from 1 to 4.I contacted Conair and once I showed them what happened, they sent me a new dryer right away. So far, so good. That is why I am reserving a 5 star rating!
I got this hair dryer for my 13 year old daughter. It's a pretty color and does as it should. However I wish it came with some attachments like a diffuser. Overall tho you get what you paid for.
For the money it is nice. Thought high setting would be more powerful but again for the price it is nice. Also bigger than I thought it would be.
kind of big for traveling but great for the house love it

Purchased about 6 months ago. I have not experienced any problems with paint chipping and peeling from the handle (as some reviewers have reported). Maybe this is because I don't use any foams or gels on my hair so my hands are clean and dry when holding the dryer. The shorter cord is actually nice because it isn't dragging across the vanity. The heat settings are perfect; no frizzing or scalp burning. And it is much lighter than any hair dryer I've owned.  I only gave it 4 stars because the low speed could be lower but overall, it's a great hair dryer.

reviewTitle: Cord is considerably shorter than previous models.
reviewDescription: This is a replacement for a previous Conair blow dryer that recently gave up the ghost after several years of daily use.This new model does not get at hot as my last one which, to be fair is probably better for my hair.It is much lighter than my previous one. That's nice.But be aware that the cord is MUCH shorter than previous models. At least a third shorter. I used to be able to sit on the side of my tub to dry my hair. Now I have to stand next to the plug. Not a big problem, but if your plug is some distance from where you can comfortably use a blow dryer it is a consideration.
I like that it's lightweight.
Has high med low speed..and hot med low heat .. and light weight
This is a very nice hairdryer, though it's a larger size. Love the varied controls, but sometimes holding the device you accidently change the control buttons by pressing them.

This hair dryer works great, just as it claims! My only issue, and it’s why I didn’t give it a 5, the high/ low rocker switch, doesn’t lick hard and is right where your fingers are and changes the power when you don’t want to! So you end up switching back and forth! My previous one had a hard lock switch! Otherwise works as needed
Nice for travel and does dry my hair quickly.

reviewTitle: Not as hot as my old Conair
reviewDescription: Like this blow dryer, replaced an older model
I liked the styleAnd lookOf the dryer! Works very well

reviewTitle: 3 heat options and a cool shot button
reviewDescription: I enjoyed the 3 heat settings (cool, warm, hot) and 2 intensities. The cool option is still warm air, but it makes drying my hair in the summer heat more bearable. I mostly use the warm setting to dry my hair.I think it does a good job at drying my hair evenly. It’s also not too heavy either. There’s a part you have to detach to clean the filter. It’s easy to remove and I found no difficulty putting it back on either.
The power was adequate. The heat and power settings were convenient and easy to use.
The hair dryer is good and I like the white for a change but the cord is too short.
For the price, this is a very nice hair dryer. It leaves my hair soft and doesn’t make it frizzy or feel brittle!

Hear me out. I've been a cosmetologist for many years at like Aveda, Paul Mitchell type salons. But needed a hair dryer for an especial purpose. Bought Amazon Strong shoe glue. It stated I needed to dry glue. Only using a blow-dryer. Retired from hairstyle and I'm a dude with no hair. Should have read the fine print before I bought not cheap glue. Is there a reason it's $12 and not $1.50! Like a plethora of cheap glue on Amazon. Well I ordered said blow dryer because...heck I fancied a lot of hair in my time. But gosh as Americans I'm so spoiled. Bought a blow-dryer to dry glue. Well the shoes were not cheap and needed repairs (DIY)! Bought back memories as a hairstyle. Well kinda. Drying glue with a blow-dryer is nothing like using it for it's actual designed purpose. Well it worked mighty fine. May e I'll come out of cosmetology retirement. Hope I'm kidding. Well in closing. Needed Heat to remedy a situation and the blow dryer went above and beyond! From a cosmetologist pov...I would recommend.  It will perform just fine and heck you might need to dry some glue. Laugh!

Good value for the price. I’ve had this blow dryer for a few months now and it is still working great and I’ve had no issues with it. I was a little worried about the size after reading a few reviews, but find it to be the perfect size.

I love this hairdryer. It blows air very well, yet it is not heavy. It has 3 settings for heat: hot, warm, and cool, and two settings for air speed: high, low and off. It really blows air very well, especially on high. Compared to the hairdryer I replaced, this is like 1000 times better! It has 1875 for the power, which is a lot of power. I can dry my hair in about 1/2 the time it took before. I doubt if you will find a better hairdryer, even if you pay more.
I've loved conair and used for years. My previous one lasted over 10 years. This one is lighter and heats up well.

This nice white hairdryer has more power than my last one. I own several vacation rentals so I bought five of these hairdryers to place in all the bathrooms in each of my rental homes. Guest appreciate a good quality hairdryer rather than a cheap weak one. I recommend. Has the attachments too for directional air. No diffuser though, but it has a low blow setting.
I love how light this hairdryer is. I have used it as a heat gun as well and it overall has held up great. Very durable.

I was hesitant on buying this dryer because a lot of the reviews we’re talking about the paint flaking off of the handle but I have not experienced anything like that. It’s actually a really nice hairdryer. Maybe because it’s still new it has not flaked but I don’t really see it starting to and I’ve used it as soon as it came out of the box. I really like the settings and it’s not too loud. the air is almost really soft. I’m enjoying it very much.

reviewTitle: Looks good, so far works good
reviewDescription: Great for the value and is an attractive color and design. I like the removable back cover to be able to clear the net to keep the airflow going. Just got it a week. I hope it lasts for a long time.

This hair dryer works well. It is not a string producer, but hair deres shouldn't be. So they tell me. This js the second one I bought. The first one was a bit messy. The white top layer of the dryer started flaking off. Eventually it wore off.
Weak air flow even when turned up to high.
Not what I thought it would be. Low power and you can’t style your hair while drying. Had to buy a different dryer
My daughter said it works but she was not impressed at all, she said it was a dud.

reviewTitle: Paint chipping off the dryer handle
reviewDescription: The dryer itself works fine.  I liked it.  But I've had it for about 4 months and suddenly, the paint on the handle chips off in my hand.  It's the ODDEST thing.  But I have to remember to wash my hands immediately after using it BEFORE touching my hair, otherwise, there's paint chips all in my hair.  Ask me how many mornings I've accidentally done that.

I have used this brand dryer for decades.  This version is the most inferior.  The best part is, it IS light. But the buttons are constantly getting accidently toggled, my brush gets stuck in the screen. That has never happened before and for 1875 speed it feels so much less than my last one.

Sooo Disappointed. Came in an open box, was missing attachments that were shown in the pictures, and takes FOREVER to dry my hair because the high/hot button blows warm air at least. Such a waste of money.

The blow dryer itself works fine, does what it’s supposed to do. However, after about a month of using it on a regular basis the white paint started rubbing off of the area where my hand goes when holding it. The pesky little specks of paint get EVERYWHERE and stick to EVERYTHING. Super frustrating, especially when trying to dry my hair quickly and then have to spend time trying to wipe off sticky paint specks. Poor quality. I guess I got what I paid for

reviewTitle: Problem with coating on handle deteriorating.
reviewDescription: I have used this dryer for the past 11 months and all of a sudden the flat coating on the handle has deteriorated and  is flaking off. When I use the dryer I get white flakes in my hair and on my face and clothing. The handle is losing its flat white appearance and has become shiny. Up until now the dryer has been fine.

Bought this dryer a year ago and left it in AK where I knew I would be returning. The hair dryer works fine but why is the white paint flaking off with use? Never had a hair dryer do that before. I have to blow the white flakes away with each use—not good to inhale,

I've used it 3-4 times a week, for 5-6 minutes each time in the past year. Paint on the handgrip started peeling off two weeks ago. Each time I use it, I get lots of white debris on my palm. I've never seen such a problem with a dozen of hairdryers I've had.

reviewTitle: No power. Don’t waste your money
reviewDescription: No power, I feel like I’m using a toy Barbee blow dryer. I hate I spent any money on it. Do yourself a favor and don’t buy this

reviewTitle: It stopped working after the third use
reviewDescription: It stopped working

This white blow dryer is PAINTED white and it chips off like glitter! It took me weeks to figure out where all the tiny tiny specks of white all over my brush handles, cords, and even hands and hair came from! UGH. dryer works great but its a constant mess.

I've purchased two of these dryers in 6 months. The first one's motor blew less strong after the first few weeks, so I exchanged it for another. The second one did the same now. It takes significantly longer to dry my hair because it isn't ask strong.Waste. Of. Money.

After using this for 6 months, the white paint coating on the hair dryer started to flake off. It was causing all kinds of little paint chips to fall in my hair and get stuck on my hands. I tried to return it but was past the return window.

reviewTitle: Blows Hot Air & That's The Only Thing Useful About It!
reviewDescription: This hair dryer is not user-friendly at all.  It's heavy & bulky, the cord is so short I can't even use it while sitting at my vanity & the air concentrator falls off every time you move the dryer the slightest bit, so it's basically useless.

reviewTitle: Heat setting button will not hold in place
reviewDescription: Overall I DID like this hair dryer but the button to make it blow hot air will not stay on the high setting unless I hold the button and try to dry my hair at the same time. I will not buy this product again.
This is how it was sent in a box worst gift purchase ever

After a few months of using this hairdryer I found tiny specks of paint everywhere.  I like the dryer, but cannot take the continued flaking, especially after finding one in the corner of my eye!  Time to find another dryer :(

This is a cute hair dryer, but even the high setting feels like it’s on low. My hair typically doesn’t take long to dry, but because this hairdryer is pretty terrible it takes 2x as long.would not recommend this product to anyone.
Suddenly stopped working after a month!!

reviewTitle: DO NOT PURCHASE THIS IF YOU WANT TO USE IT FOR A LONG TIME
reviewDescription: Mediocre blowing power (high and cool has same temperature?), white paint chipping which is a major health hazard (who knows what these paint chips are made out of?).  Consider yourself warned.
Died on me after 36 days!
Stops working after 4 months

reviewTitle: The white coating flakes off like glitter everywhere!
reviewDescription: Initially I loved this dryer. It really dried my hair nicely. I really liked the removable filter that made cleaning out lint buildup easy. However, the huge negative was the white coating on the handle started flaking after 2 months. The little white flakes on my hands where difficult to wash off and forget about trying to get it off clothing and surfaces. I did not realize that was where it was coming from at first. I am still finding them, like glitter. I missed the return window and had to throw it away.

I loved this blow dryer when I bought it, but the surface finish is now deteriorating. Flecks of white are beginning to stick to my hands, hair, floor. It is very difficult to remove them. I keep my appliance in the bathroom on a loop holder that is used in salons, not in a drawer or somewhere that it can’t cool properly after use. I’m disappointed in the quality and that I can’t return it now. It has only been since February this year, about 3 or 4 months.

reviewTitle: IT DID NOT WORK AT ALL
reviewDescription: I think this item had already been returned once since the box was not sealed nor was the bag that the hair dryer came in sealed. IT did not work at all and I was quite surprised to receive something that did not work at all. I even had a friend try it out to make sure....

I just bought this hair dryer last June and today the fan is hardly blowing. It still heats up and blows some air but not enough and it’s making a weird noise and a burning smell. My old one last me over 10 years. And this one not even 6 months. Not worth the money.
It’s only been a month and this already blew out stopped worked and started sparking

This hair dryer does NOT get hot enough to style hair. Might be good for someone with short hair that doesn’t use this as a styling tool. I threw the box away immediately thinking it would be fine. But now I can’t return it without the box (return instructions say pack in original box)
works like a charm
Drying hair
The blow dryer works well and is reasonably priced. If you don't need anything too fancy this is a good one. I use the high airflow with cool air.

Multifuncional en todo el sentido de la palabra, las diferente velocidades que tiene, que tiene un boto especifico para aire mas frio de lo regular. Si estas empezando en el mundo del cuidado del cabello esta seria una excelente herramienta de calor
Not high powered but works
Alohalike these hair dryers with very hot heatgood for hair type like mines
Stylish, seems well made, and works as it should.
I love this blow dryer works so good

There is really nothing special about this hairdryer, which is exactly the point. I just needed to replace my old hairdryer whose motor was burning out, and I needed it to dry my hair.  Check.This model has 2 heat settings and 2 airflow settings, plus a cool shot button to hold for cool air.  Does the ionic conditioning feature work?  No idea, as my hair didn't come out frizzy with my old dryer either. Does the concentrator nozzle work?  The knowledge I gained in fluid dynamics and nozzles while working towards my Mechanical Engineering degree tells me this will properly accelerate the airflow, just as you'd expect.Unless you have a dire need to color coordinate your hairdryer with the furnishings in your bathroom (which, let's face it, if you have that need, you are likely paying someone else to buy your hairdryer and not reading this review), I don't see why you'd buy a more expensive model.

reviewTitle: Conair Secador de pelo de cerámica doble
reviewDescription: exelente la calidad de esta secadora estupenda
Awesome hair dryer. So light weight. The hot setting is not so hot that it burns your hair or head. Would recommend to everyone.
My wife likes it. She has real thick long hair.  Says it’s fine.
We love this brand and so happy we could find this on Amazon and ship to my daughter in Arizona.
It's the same name and wattage as my old one. I was so surprised at how much more quiet it is. I like it.
Works great. Dries my hair really fast which works great for me, for I am always in a hurry, jump in the shower and out the door.
we like this hair dryer because it is lightweight and easy to use and does a good job
I just purchased this to replace my old Chi that died. I enjoy the lower heat setting with high dryer speed. would definitely recommend.

Wasn't sure what to expect From a ceramic blow dryer, but it's probably the nicest blow dryer I've ever had. It's very comfortable, light weight and not too loud. It doesn't blow really hard but hot enough to dry my hair and not burn my scalp!!Really happy with this purchase!

reviewTitle: It works and a great value.
reviewDescription: This handheld hair dryer does what it says it will do. It has two options for heat and two options for blowing power. It comes with the directional attachment. It works perfectly. It isn't rocket science. I don't see any reason to pay for a more expensive version.
Temperatura y caudal excelente siento que cuida mi cabello

reviewTitle: Perfect - Except not enough handle room - accidentially change settings trying to use it
reviewDescription: Hairdryer would be perfect except there is not enough room on the handle to hold it without hitting the control buttons and turning it from high to med or med to low on accident, I do it 2 or 3 x every use. It's annoying

I love this dryer, its a bit heavy but works really well, smooth healthy hair. Its 5 dtars except one thing, handle white is flaking all over my hands  brush. At first I thought it was product but have realised its the dryer material

The power is the same as my old one. I was disappointed in the length of the cord. The shortness of the cord requires me to keep close to the vanity and the electrical outlet.A longer cord allows for more flexibility.
This dryer is not the greatest. It doesn’t get very hot and seems like it takes me double the time to dry my hair as it did with my other smaller dryer.

I want to start off with I do like this hair dryer. I am right handed and I feel like this is more designed for lefties. It’s kinda awkward when blowing out another persons hair. The cord is not very long either. It kept coming unplugged when giving a blowout. I do like the design and how quickly itdries. It is not too hot; as someone stated in the comments the heat feels like a towel coming out of the dryer. I do agree. I would recommend but until I work out the kinks I wouldn’t purchase again. 4/5 stars. I got the full size also.Edit to add: I have had this for a few months now and I still hit the buttons to turn it off by accident, but I do like it. I hate that it comes unplugged so easy also. I would purchase again. 4/5 stars still stands in my opinion.

I don't know why Conair decided to cheap out on the power cable. Im 5'7" and my power outlet is one of those near 1 foot above floor level. I can just barely get the hair dryer over my head! I'm pretty much just around average height. What about those who are taller? They would not be able to use this without getting an extension cable... Real shame this was where they decided to do some cost saving. Other than that the hair dryer works great.

I have used Conair for years. This is my go to for hair dryers. I'm surprised it isn't broken because it was shipped in its own Conair box which was smashed, punctured and not even tightly sealed. Amazon should be ashamed of this packaging. I'm just assuming hair dryer is undamaged because it worked when I turned it on.

This is the prettiest blow dryer I've ever had. The white with a touch of bronze is so lovely. Functionality is also very effective. My hair doesn't feel overheated when I'm styling it and there's no frizz on the ends from heat exposure. My only complaint is that I wish the electrical cord was a bit longer. At 5' it's just a tad too short for my comfort as I'm used to one that's 6' long. Guess everything is getting reduced these days.
Have it as a gift and she loves it
Thanks

reviewTitle: The spray over paint it terrible. It's EVERYWHERE!!!!
reviewDescription: The blow dryer itself is great. I do wish it would fold and has a cord that sucks in. However, the biggest irritation about this dryer is the paint. Literally the white pieces are coming off and getting stuck onto everything: my hands, the counter and I find it in my hair. I was hoping that it wouldn't be such a bad thing but it's really bad. Not sure if I can return it or exchange it but it sucks that I would just rather buy another dryer if I cannot replace this one.
I only used it twice and the white came off in tiny pieces onto my fingers and in my hair.
No, cumplió con mis deseos lo devolví ya que el calor y la potencia no eran lo que esperaba....

reviewTitle: Pain chips come off this hairdryer EVERYDAY
reviewDescription: Seems this is a typical conair problem which is insane.  The paint they use chips and comes out on my hands and my hair.  It looks like lead paint honestly!!

The hair dryer blew air at a very low rate to begin with but I kept it thinking it was fine due to not needing to use it often. I’ve had the hair dryer for a month and maybe have used it 5 times and now has completely stopped working but smells smoky when plugged in. An unfortunate waste of money.

I usually love Conair products but I hate this “ceramic” dryer. After using it for a few months, I would notice white paint chips on my hands after each use. If you look closely at the picture of the dryer, you can see where the outer layer is peeling away. The white chips get on everything- clothes, skin, etc. i wish I didn’t choose this model.

The paint seems to be coming off of the handle non-stop and gets stuck in the back of the blowdryer and sticks to EVERYTHING (hair, clothes, hands, walls, etc) - seems poorly crafted.It also doesn't seem very powerful compared to other dryers I've had in the past. Sadly the return window closed literally right before the paint started to chip and flake otherwise I would've tried to return it. Never buying this model again.

reviewTitle: I bought this and it is broken in few days
reviewDescription: It iş very cheap product
I received a used dryer. Price has now increased and return requires label and trip to ups

This isn't a real Conair. It has a fraction of the air and heat output. The cord is very short. The white plastic started sluffing about 3 months after we got it blowing small hot white pieces of plastic all over me and the bathroom!  I bought a real Conair and threw this junk in the trash.

reviewTitle: Stopped working after 1.5mo, right after return window closed
reviewDescription: If the price seems too good to be true… it’s because IT IS. Received this product in perfect brand new condition. It worked well given the price - aka not very strong airflow or high heat, but that is to be expected for this price point, and was good enough to get the job done. HOWEVER what I did not expect was for it to stop working shortly after the return window closed. On full speed the air flows as if it’s on the lowest setting and feels warm at best. I’ve tried resetting my outlet and the hairdryer plug, and even trying it in a different outlet, all to no avail. I might as well be AIR drying my hair. Such a disappointment, and really appalled at the quality of such a well-known and respected affordable brand.

The motor for the hair dryer is going off while using it  and then  suddenly starts up again. I am concerned that it is NOT  safe and will have to toss it. This was a replacement for same  design and size Conair hair dryer that was pretty old ,  but the cord  got frayed . It worked great till then.I would return this Conair dryer I  but threw away packaging because I could not imagine it would break in a week!I think it is dangerous.

reviewTitle: WHITE FLECKS EVERYWHERE!  Not Original ConAir Corp
reviewDescription: Purchased this white ConAir blow dryer mid September 2022.  Tested immediately and it worked well in terms of heat and drying the hair.  Yet, I don't use blow dryers often being I prefer to air dry my hair.  However, there are times a blow dryer is needed. I pulled this model out after 3 months and white flecks are flying everywhere making a mess!  In my lifetime, I have owned a fair amount of ConAir products.  The items always performed and held up very well.  I never had to return the product or throw it in the trash.I tried calling "Con-AIR" now owned by American Securities since 2021, and each time I was on the line holding.  After 17 minutes my calls were dropped.. The website does not list their hours of operation.I wish I had read the 1 and 2 star reviews.  More junk from ......you know where and more refuse for our landfill!! UGH!

Like another review has mentioned, the white paint chips off in my hand while using. This happened shortly after purchase, I should have returned it. Poor quality design, switching to revlon for my next blow dryer.

I unfortunately waited too late to return this item but I regret the purchase. The paint on this hair dryer flakes off and sticks to your hands and then when you touch your hair it comes off in your hair and it’s hard to get out. I walk around with random white paint chips in my hair sometimes without even knowing it until I see it later in the day. It’s pretty much going in the trash as soon as I purchase a better one.

reviewTitle: This poor thing didn't last 3 months.
reviewDescription: The hair drier died after 3 months of use.  I used it on most days.  The company did offer a new product as there is a 2 year warranty.  The new replacement will arrive in about 2 to 3 weeks.  I will have to buy a different hair drier to cover those weeks I have to wait for the replacement.
Had this for 7 months with infrequent use. Completely stopped working one day. Things aren’t made to last anymore.

So at first I really liked this hair dryer other than first noticing that the cord was shorter than my previous hair dryer but I was okay with that because it was less cord to tangle/store under my bathroom cabinet. After a month of using, the paint around the handle began chipping. It got so obnoxious that there were little white paint chips in my hair and all over my hands. It was never in a bathroom with lots of steam/condensation so I can’t imagine what this would’ve been like if it had been. It dryers great and I love the low medium high heat functions but this paint chipping is unbearable. My advice: keep looking

PAINT CHIPPING DISASTER. I'm deeply disappointed by the quality of the product I purchased. Unfortunately, the paint on the item chips off excessively, making it an unpleasant experience every time I use it. Even the simple act of using a blowdryer results in paint chips covering my hands, which is certainly not what I expected. It's evident that there is a significant issue with the product's design or materials.What adds to my frustration is the lack of responsiveness from the Conair team. I've taken the initiative to reach out to customer service three times in hopes of finding a solution, but regrettably, I haven't received any form of assistance or even acknowledgment.I had higher expectations from Conair, given their reputation, and the absence of support has left me genuinely let down. I hope my feedback reaches the relevant parties and sparks some attention to address these concerns.

Used maybe 8 times And the other day it started smelling like smoke…Tried again today and it immediately started melting something inside!!!had to take it outside😱I’d rather have an expensive dryer that works. Than one that will burn itself up!!! 🥹

Functionally the hair dryer is excellent.  Unfortunately shortly after purchase, the white paint or coating began to flake off.  I first noticed the flakes sticking to my hand after using the dryer.  I found that I had to wash my hands to remove them.  I tried cleaning and scrubbing the dryer, but to no avail. The more I scrubbed, the more flakes appeared. With the concern of environmental microplastics which can be non-biodegradable, I didn't want to risk exposure.  I simply replaced it.
Very weak. I sent it back. Got a refund no problem.

Don't buy this dryer if you don't want to have little white specks all over your hands, face, hair and everything that your hands come in contact with.  I have had this dryer for exactly one year and about the 10 month mark, the white finish on the handle is breaking off into little flakes and sticking to everything.  Now I have to buy a new dryer, so frustrating.
It works fine it just began peeling within the first few uses. It’s worse than the photos even show. I should have returned it but never got around to it. Very low quality and not worth your money.

reviewTitle: Coating melts off and gets stuck to your hands
reviewDescription: This hair dryer sucks. It gets hot and then the plastic coating melts off onto your hands and gets on everything.
I noticed even on the highest setting it is not nearly as powerful or effective as some with the same wattage

I had been using a Conair hair dryer (the orange one) that had worked great for years. I wasn’t a fan of the color, though, so when it finally gave out, I selected another Conair of equal power (1875 watts). This one does the job, but the motor sounds a bit tinny, and the cool down button isn’t really cool air. It’s less warm, but because it’s not cool, it doesn’t “set” the curve or smooth effect I’m trying to achieve. I’ve had the dryer for several months, and I  think I’m finally going to try something else, probably Conair again.

reviewTitle: Love the hair dryer but the cord is too short!
reviewDescription: Live the hair dryer, various settings, but the cord is too short.

I read all the reviews on this before purchasing but wanted this 1875 model as it is similar to previous model which is still working fine. I just needed a concentrator and must have lost it as I never used a concentrator previously. After reading so many reviews of basically all hair dryers shorting out, burning up, etc., decided to go with the cheapest one lol. The finish is a very matte finish yet people complained that it chips off. Not sure if they changed the finish but it is not shiny. We will see. Having said that, had seen a video that shows finish getting scratched and she determined (and showed) how it was the metal prongs on the plug that scratches it. I will be careful in storing it in a way where the plug isn't rubbing on the dryer. I do hope it doesn't start to flake as that would be so annoying. What I like about dryer:- Lightweight.  I find it very light and easy to hold. I have RA so that is important to me.- All control settings seem to work well. The cool setting is actually cool. Cool shot works well also.  For my thin blonde hair, low and warm will work well, with occasionally medium speed blowing.  Not sure why some said it does not get hot. The hot on mine is hot! Too hot for my hair.What I don't like:- I do think they shortened the cord a little although I didn't measure. It still works for me as my outlet is  counter height.- It is not super noisy and is quieter than my previous one.- My hair is smooth after drying with a natural bristled brush.For me the price of $20 was worth it since reviews of all price ranged dryers seemed to have issues. Overall I do think Conair's quality has decreased a bit, as has everything else. At the same time I've used this brand all of my life so safest bet for me. I will update if any real issues arise.

reviewTitle: Less heat and less air forced through equals quieter
reviewDescription: I just used this hair dryer for the first time this morning.  The buttons on my old one stopped working so I had to replace it.  I chose this one based on its price.  Bargain priced for sure.  First impressions:1. It has less intense heat than my old one.  I used the highest setting and it didn't feel hot.  Not cold either but you could definitely feel the heat with my old dryer.2. The cord is shorter than my old one.  Not a major problem for me but if you need a long cord, this may not be for you.3. The amount of air forced through for drying didn't seem to be as great as my old one either.That being said, there was NO DIFFERENCE IN DRY TIME BETWEEN old and new dryers.  That was weird.  I thought that with less air, it might take longer, but it didn't.  You should know I have fine hair that dries easily anyway.Furthermore, IT IS MUCH QUIETER than the old one.  This is a BIG DEAL to me.  I had originally searched for the quietest hair dryers out there but they were all quite pricey.  This one is much quieter than expected so I feel like I have a win on my hands here.  I would say the sound is still slightly higher pitched than ideal, but I think I'll disturb the rest of the house less with this one.You will see people comment about the finish and that it will flake off.  Can confirm that it will probably happen.  It happened with my old hair dryer too which had the same matte finish coat.  But I'm the only one who uses it so I don't care too much if the finish eventually flakes.Overall, I would recommend this hair dryer.
Tiene buen tamaño para transportarla y es cómoda de manejar, aunque un poco débil la potencia del aire.
It’s a nice looking hairdryer. I don’t feel like it blows air out powerful enough for my liking but  it works okay.  I’ve purchased several in the last month and I’ve decided to keep this one

reviewTitle: Good dryer but needs a re-design
reviewDescription: I like this dryer very much - dries well, hot enough and fairly lightweight. My only problem is with the design of the switches - they are rocker switches and are placed on the handle exactly where your thumb goes when holding it. I find myself turning it off or lowering the heat without meaning to. I'm trying to train myself to place my thumb on the heat setting set on high to keep in place. Conair - either change these to sliding switches or move them.

reviewTitle: Works well for me and my needs
reviewDescription: I like everything about it, albeit, it's still new to me, so I'm still developing a relationship with it.  It's lightweight, and that's a big plus for me.  I also like the temperature settings as well as the airflow speeds.  Seems we'll get along quite well.

It works great.  I wish the selection buttons were slides instead of flips because I end up flipping them by mistake while I'm using it.  Also wish the cord was retractable.All in all -- I got exactly what I ordered and I'm satisfied with it.
